name: Megan Lodge
text:
This is a beautiful place to get married, well worth the price. Originally me and my now husband were going to have our wedding somewhere else but due to covid 19 they cancelled on us 3 weeks before our wedding. We called and left a voice mail to get prices for Burns Bluff and Mrs. Tillery called us back and set up a tour for that weekend.

We toured and instantly fell in love with the place. It is gorgeous. They fit us in so that we could get married june 20th, when the original daye was the 6th. That just shows how quickly and efficently they got us on the books and ready to go.
You don't realize how much of a blessing it is to have sleeping accomation for not only yourself, but the wedding party (depending on the size) until after everything is over. We went with the big package and were able to sleep 28. I didnt have to worry about people being late because most of the party was there the night before.

We also got the decorations closet, which was also a blessing. I didn't have to go find decorations or agonize over how to decorate. They asked me my opinion and set everything up. It was gorgeous.

Cathy Mayer was our coordinator and thanks to her and Mrs. Tillery, I did not have to worry about anything the day of my wedding. They took care of everything that came up and if anything went wrong, I don't know about it.

A small piece of advice though, close off the main living space before everyone gets there. Designate someone to do it. We forgot to, and there was so many people walking around the living room and kitchen, going into peoples rooms, that it was suffocating. That's the only thing I would change, and that was totally on me to do.

I will post some pictures when I get them. You won't regret having your wedding here.

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us with your special day, Megan!  And thank you so much for your kind words! Your entire family was precious and such a joy to work with. Thank you for the heads up on making sure the door to the main house is closed and monitored. We will add that to our list and make sure that we have someone to keep wedding guests from coming in and disturbing the wedding party and family prior to the wedding!  Best wishes for you and Patrick and for an amazing life together!!!

name: Jeff Szarek
text:
This course came recommended by some people at work. We set up a tee time the day before for Saturday. We traveled about 40 mins to the course. It was right off the highway into a gated golf community. Right from the start we were greeted by the staff. Upon entering the clubhouse, I was amazed at the initial set up of the course. My co-worker had to rent some clubs, at which they were very accommodating by giving him a brand new set of Nike Vapors. I had the Coverts 2.0 from the previous year and was impressed at the rentals they provided. We went to the driving range and then the putting green and we were off. Long story short, the course was AWESOME and the view was even better. We found ourselves stopping to take pictures and taking in the view (Which I rarely do on course). What I thought was to be a 6 hr round (because of our relax play at each hole) was a little over 4 hrs. This course is in my TOP 5 best courses I've played in my life, (I've played in the range of 50-60 different courses). I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys a challenge, but also a forgiving course layout. The scenic views are something out of a movie which as to the relaxation of the game of golf. If you are ever in the area, you have to check out this course.

A big Thank You to the staff there at Cherokee Ridge who were some of the top notch personnel a course can have. Jonathan Watts, a Graduate of the Golf Academy of America Orlando, did not disappoint to the customer service and knowledge one would find at that school.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Darryl Gutierrez
text: This is a museum in the private home of artist and poet (Maria) Howard Weeden. The cost is $5 and the tour is about an hour long. I found it to be a fascinating glimpse into not only Weeden's life and art, but also the early history of Huntsville and North Alabama. Like many private museums, Weeden house has had to branch out to make ends meet so they rent the place out as an event venue as well. This means that Lynn, their lone employee is stretched rather thin as tour guide, event coordinator, curator and hostess so you should make an appointment for the guided tour. Nevertheless, she was as gracious and informative a hostess as you could wish for. Word of caution- there are stairs so if you have mobility issues you may miss the upstairs part of the tour.

name: Ken Barnes
text:
Our wedding and reception was in the back yard of the Weeden House. We had lots of questions and requests, and their event/property manager was incredibly flexible and responsive. It was a magical event, and the Weeden House was a huge part of making it feel special.

Note: it's one of the few facilities in Huntsville that does weddings but allows you to bring your own alcoholic drinks. No forced catering!

People who use chairs do go to parties, bridal and baby showers too.  I was disappointed with the venue for the shower that I paid a rather large sum of money to help host.  It was the location that the bride requested but never again!!!

text: I got married May 2021, I can not say enough good things about the venue as well as the people who run it. Chad and Lindsey even jumped in and cut our cake when they saw the opportunity to help. They even cleaned up all our decorations and organized them so our packing would be easier on us the next day. The property itself was stunning. Very accommodating and had plenty of room for the bridal party. I wouldn’t change a thing. Best experience I’ve ever had!

name: Well Nested
text: I coordinated a wedding here that was planned for April of 2020 but got rescheduled to September of 2020. The venue owner was wonderful to work with in both planning and rescheduling due to the pandemic. When the time finally came, it was a beautiful event at a perfect venue. Triple T Farms had everything we needed for a gorgeous wedding weekend, and the amenities made everything easy. The weekend of, the owner and the venue coordinator made things easy and stress free. There had even been a hurricane the week prior to the September date and they’d worked extremely hard to make sure the property was picture perfect for the wedding. I highly recommend Triple T Farms for your next event.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind review!!   It means so much to us that you took  the time to leave us one. We are grateful for it. Thank you!!

name: Sheri Garriga
text: I have the pleasure of personally knowing the owner of Triple T Farms. Chad, the owner, is a dedicated and hard worker. He is loyal and trustworthy. You can depend on him  and his staff to help make your special day even more memorable. Triple T Farms is a breath taking, picture perfect venue. From the natural beauty of the colorful flowers and trees, to the glistening pond,  and  rustic barn, this is a must see! I recommend anyone planning a wedding or a special event to have it at this hidden treasure. You won’t be disappointed!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your amazing review Sheri!!  We are grateful you took the time to leave us such kind words.

name: Brooke Ponder
text: I would recommend this venue to anyone and everyone! We got married on May 22nd at Triple T farm Wedding Venue. It was the most perfect day. Everything went so smooth. Chad and Jennifer are the sweetest people to work with. They will make sure you are taken care of and they will take the stress off of you. They stay in contact with you throughout the process to make sure you do not have any questions or concerns. Very responsive whenever you need something. The venue is beautiful. There are different spots you can choose for your ceremony and they are all perfect. The reception barn is gorgeous. The lights are already strung up in the barn and the tables are set out however you want them. You have the option of choosing the bridal house and the grooms cabin to stay in the night before your wedding and night of. We chose to do so and  it was so easy for all of the bridesmaids to already be at the venue the morning of because we all spent the night in the bridal house. We stayed the night of our wedding as well! Everything about this place is perfect!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review and kind words Brooke! It was such a joy and honor to be a part of you and Logan’s special day. We are so grateful for the opportunity to share your beautiful wedding with you and your families. Triple T Farm and family wished you both a lifetime of love and happiness.

Full wheelchair access to all areas, TVs throughout the buildings, covered dance floor with a built in DJ booth, even the parking could easily fit 150 cars just to name a few things!

If you are thinking about getting married, a birthday, company function etc then you should Consider calling D2C!

name: Claire Rhinehart
text: My husband and I are thankful we found The Lake House at Camellia Palms for our wedding. From the moment we arrived, we knew this was the perfect place for our dream wedding. Taylor and her staff were so helpful as we planned our wedding from another state during a pandemic. She recommended the best vendors to help us create our dream wedding. The bride's and groom's suites were roomy and the perfect places to get ready. Marrying my best friend beside the lake was the most amazing moment of my life. I highly recommend booking your wedding at The Lake House at Camellia Palms!

name: Studio Sisters
text: We have held several artist retreats and events here. The owners and staff were wonderful to work with and everything was clear. Not only was our hospitality experience flawless, this business and the owner are highly engaged with their downtown's historic downtown revitalization and has a really cool internship program where they are creating jobs for young people in their community. You can expect nothing but a great experience working with Camellia Palms.

resp.text: We appreciate your positive review, it means so much to us! Our team is dedicated to creating positive guest experiences and we are always happy to that our hand-in-hand approach led to a great stay with your artist retreats. We feel that our venue is the perfect place for a quiet, creative, and calm getaway!

name: Mark Burch
text: The Lake House team was excellent. They were very efficient in setting up and cleaning up the event. Taylor, the director and coordinator, was extremely helpful and full of advice. She also made it easy for the vendors we hired to do their job well by offering them information they needed concerning the house.  She was a terrific host, and really helped make our experience a memorable one. The house is beautiful, as is the scenery around the house. Hopefully we can go back some day.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We truly enjoyed working with you & Gabbi on every detail of your GORGEOUS wedding! There were so many special details and the vendors you chose were so amazing to work with. We can't get over those fabulous custom honey jars you gave away as party favors! Thank you again for choosing Camellia Palms for your wedding venue.

name: Katie Smith
text:
Kind Staff & Amazing lakeside views!

The owner, Taylor, & her staff were extremely kind and professional, which made check in super easy and stress-free. Thank you so much for the wonderful stay!

The house and deck was very clean, I wanted to spend all of my time out on that beautiful back deck, I especially  loved the rocking chairs overlooking the lake.

name: Lauren Hooper
text: Spending the week here, overlooking the water, creating with friends was one of the best weeks of my life! The house is so beautiful and has so much historic charm. We enjoyed our meals flooded with light from the huge bay windows and had plenty of space for 12 of us to eat together each meal and play games at night in the living room. The event room was perfect for us as we painted each day and had plenty of space to create. Then we were quickly and easily able to walk down to the lake and into downtown to explore the charming local shops. Taylor was so thoughtful and helpful and made sure we had everything we needed to have the best time possible! We even got to meet her pet pig, Chip, who was a huge hit! We cant wait to come back to Camellia Palms and make more memories!

name: Lynn Kluczynski
text: We had a delightful quilt retreat with 8 women. The house is filled with charming decor. The bedrooms were are unique. There were fresh flowers on every mantel. The towels were big and fluffy, the claw foot tubs were awesome. Our work space was preset for us. They provided tables, lights, extension cords, cutting stations with mats, ironing stations with irons, it was perfect. The view of the lake while sewing all day was perfect. We explored local shops and places to eat. A real perk was our breakfast bar prepared for us each morning, spoiling us . The house is large enough that we all had privacy when needed. It was a wonderful experience. A true gem off the beaten path.

name: Theresa Collins-Hill
text: What a beautiful venue!  Looking for your dream wedding experience?   Look no further!   A warm welcome awaits you with truly professional and caring owners.

name: Matthew Leu
text: We found this place on Airbnb about 2 years ago. We were watched by cameras and called on a daily basis about things they didn’t like that we did. It was weird. When we left, we had several additional “cleaning” charges added to our bill. Stay away from Airbnb rentals. They hide behind the women owned and vet owned labels. Neither of which is really true. You’ve been warned.

resp.text:
Matthew, your review is so far from the truth and misogynistic that it is barely worth responding to but I will try.
The truth is that
1. You have never been a registered guest on our airbnb.  Perhaps you were the spouse of one.
2. yes we do have cameras pointed ONLY to the outside of the property and that is clearly stated in our listing.
3. We never once called you during your stay.
4. The extra cleaning charges were due to the fact that your party treated our historic home like a frat house , leaving food in every room, on the floor, under the beds , and having more people than you were allowed. We have the photos to prove how disgusting this group was while at our home.
5. We are ,as owners,  both women and one of us has the dd214 to prove veteran status. You met me, and I'm clearly female.
6. Of the hundreds of guests we've hosted , I'm sure that they could all attest that we are indeed WOMEN !!
7. My business partner is extremely insulted that you would dare accuse a veteran of lying about their service.  YOU obviously never served  or you would understand how offensive you sound when lying about this.
8. We are proud to offer our military guests and fellow veterans  a 10% discount.

name: Brandie McGinnis
text: Cutest place ever. I just love their pink door. Super friendly

name: tye shirley
text: Such a cute place. I love their overall aesthetic. It’s so charming and cozy. You’ll love it!

name: Lillian Jones
text: I love the gorgeous house, incredible ceremony site views, and the landscape is SO unique. There’s so many beautiful things about this wedding venue.

name: McKenzie Newman
text: Such a cute and quaint venue. The owner, Taylor, is so passionate about ensuring an event goes smoothly and incredibly professional.

name: Tracy Englund
text: It's so nice when the owners care as much about their clients as they do their home! Beautiful, five star!

name: Kathy Schrock
text: The Lake House at Camellia Palms is a beautiful place to host your wedding or retreat. Taylor and her staff are top notch professionals.

name: Sandi Scroggins
text: I love this venue and appreciate how accommodating the staff are.  I have attended several events there and have always had a positive experience.  This Lake House is a historic building that is absolutely gorgeous and sits on several acres that overlook Lake Jackson.  Lounging on the back deck looking out on the lake is very relaxing and peaceful.  They also have a hammock which is perfect for a late afternoon snooze.  I highly recommend the Lake House and encourage folks who are looking for a destination get-away, special event or holiday to consider booking here.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Sandi, for this kind review. We genuinely appreciate the time you took to write this review about your positive guest experience. Our staff LOVES working with guests and we are always happy to welcome you to Camellia Palms.

text: Camellia Palms is a dream come true!  From the lakeside views, to the personalized service, I felt like I was in paradise! Highly Recommend!!!

name: Tabatha Smith
text:
I have attended several events at the Lake House, including quilt retreats, family get togethers, yoga, and even a craft fair. I have had wonderful experiences every time and would give Taylor, her staff and the venue 10 stars if I could. They are courteous and attend to your needs. The venue is historic, charming and clean.  The grounds are expansive and overlook the lake. Relax on the large deck out back, Stroll along the lake, walk the downtown area too!
I love that the venue is non- smoking too and pet free too for those guest that have allergies.
I can highly recommend this venue and Taylor every time!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We work very hard to make our guests happy with their stay! We find that when guests understand our venue's unique offerings and the value of  a smoke-free venue, they have a great experience that is peaceful and calming. Thank you and please come again!

name: Debbie Ladnier
text: I do not have very good writing skills.  Wonderful and great and fun are not stong enough words. how to say what i experienced. I can't even begin to tell you how much I learned to improve my quilting quilting skills. it was beautiful ,serene, challenging and a word have I haven't used in a long time fun. So thankful to have such a great place to go. It was like my Disney World of quilting.

name: Sarah Hopkins
text: Simply gorgeous venue for a wedding. The staff are lovely and easy to work with.

name: Kelley Penn
text: I love this place! Not only is it gorgeous architecture and decor, I always enjoy my trips.  I've been to several yoga retreats and markets at the Lake House. The Staff works so hard to get as many local products and services involved in her packages.  All the events have been well organized, well planned, very thought out.  I'm more than impressed with Taylor, the director.  She goes above and beyond that any guest has great memories of this historic house.

name: Ricky Lively
text: The wedding being mentioned was my wife and mine. The venue was very beautiful as stated. House has a lot of charm as Taylor her self did. That quickly became different. She is a saleswoman for sure. This venue was not cheap. We were given a contract and was told verbally that a lot things we could do then told I was not telling the truth. Even though I had witnesses. We did have an amazing wedding even though all of this was going on. I do have video and pics of the stalking staff at almost every angle of the wedding. That made it so uncomfortable. Amd being threatened with fines every 30 minutes. That got old real quick. Hope this venue gets new owners soon. They will go under fast at this rate. If looking to get married here please don’t let her charm get you as well from the rip.

resp.text:
We are so thankful that out of more than 50 events in 2020, all but one wedding event was successful and the couples were wonderful to work with. We appreciate that the majority of our wedding couples and their guests have all been polite and respectful of our historic venue, especially in a stressful year such as 2020 due to Covid-19. At all but one of our weddings and events, guests have been willing to follow the safety rules and have been willing to work with our staff to modify their wedding plans to follow Alabama’s Covid-19 requirements. Our staff has worked very hard to still create safe and beautiful weddings even in a time that is not ideal. Only one wedding this year failed to communicate these requirements to their guests and, as a result, their guests and wedding party failed to follow our social distancing requirements and also broke our venue rules in regards to smoking and safe alcohol consumption. When our team has communicated these rules at all of our weddings and events this year, only one wedding party reacted poorly and refused to be reasonable and berated our staff.

All of our weddings receptions promptly end at 10:00 pm and all guests are asked to leave the property at this time. It is unfortunate when intoxicated guests react poorly to these rules but we are grateful that all but one of our wedding couples this year has communicated the contract and wedding end times successfully to their invited guests. It is also unfortunate that this particular couple did not bring any concerns to us during the event but rather their guests have chosen to spam us with dishonest reviews on various social media platforms. We love working with couples and brides and are confident in our reviews and ratings which are 100% 5 stars with the exception of this particular wedding event which broke our venue rules and has given an untruthful statement about our venue and our team. We look forward to the lifting of all Covid-19 restrictions in the future and our team continues to be focused on wonderful customer service.

name: Shelby Hartman
text: Beautiful spot for a wedding! Love the charm of this place.

name: Stephanie Huffman
text: This venue is GORGEOUS! The views, the accommodations, owners, AND the pink doors 👌 😍.

name: Gracie Simmons
text: I hosted a yoga retreat here last September and I’m dreaming of being able to return as soon as this Covid-crisis slows! Taylor was a most gracious host, opening her serene historic home to us and entrusting us to make memories responsibly. Her requirements of no red wine or smoking on the premises made perfect sense to keep the house pristine and welcoming for the next occupants. Our guests had no issues with this. They brought white wine instead and walked far away from the house if they needed to smoke. Taylor communicated well with me from the very beginning and allowed me to tour the house before making my decision. The house is conveniently located to the beautiful lake Jackson with the most beautiful sunrises and sunsets you can imagine! I will most definitely be returning here as soon as possible with my yoga tribe!

resp.text: Gracie, thank you so much for your kind words! It was such a pleasure to host your yoga retreat and we hope for many more to come. We are grateful that your group had such a positive experience with us and that our team did an excellent job conveying the requirements of our historic home and no-smoking policy. Lake Jackson is  such a beautiful place and we're so happy that it was a great fit for a peaceful yoga retreat!

name: Adler Ranch
text: Beautiful setting and venue owners that care about their clients!

name: kelly king
text: Beautiful venue! Highly recommend it!

name: Aleah Chilleen
text: The pink door though!! This venue is amazing!

name: Karl Snider
text: A beautiful venue and lovely owners!

name: Jeanne Lively
text: I was going to be quiet here but they keep removing reviews and they were very disrespectful to my mother who they knew had been with me all day and was disabled. They weren’t going to let her upstairs (which was not handicap accessible anyway) to change in to something more comfortable that she had upstairs in my room, threatened to fine us, and kick her out besides the many other rude and disrespectful things that happen during the day. Definitely see my public post on FB. Oh I’m just in shock at how things turned out at this beautiful place. Looks like someone else needs to buy it so it won’t be wasted with staff that are currently in everyone of my venue pictures. But the devil himself couldn’t have ruined our day. The wedding was amazing and beautiful because we are so in love and was surrounded by so many friends that love and support us. I just think the business should have been ran more professionally and there will most likely be a lawsuit against the owner in the future.

name: Ashley Payne
text:
If you plan on using this venue as your wedding or for a special event then you MUST read this honest and fair review. It may be a bit long of a read but if you want a current and an honest review on our experience here then please read this.

The property is absolutely beautiful and has a lot of historic charm. The house is spacious and can probably accommodate any event. It's an older house so the layout is different but still functioned what the event needed. Thats pretty much the only positive thing I can say about our recent experience here. My friends recently, as in yesterday, got married at this property and the staff, one in particular, were rude, inappropriate at times, unprofessional, condescending and over bearing all while smothering the bride, groom and wedding party along with all the guest that were staying and attended the wedding. The staff never left at any point and hovered over the guest making it feel uncomfortable and uninviting as possible which is not the proper tone for a wedding. They gave conflicting rules on the fly such as no smoking on the property and to go to a spot about a 100 yards away which was actually public property and could lead to you getting arrested for public intox if you want to be technical not to mention extremely inconvenient. Another example: one of the guest that was staying in the house was told to leave the inside of the house as its only for those who are staying here. She was reminded more than once that said person is indeed staying and has his own room in the house. Later that night another guest who was also staying was standing in the kitchen and was told it was more of a prep kitchen and not a hang out and get drunk kitchen and to remove himself from the kitchen area. The staff constantly complained about every little thing we did and without being biased at all and being completely honest, we were extremely respectful of the property as we were there to have a wedding and were there to celebrate two of our close friends getting married and wanted it to go as perfectly as possible. The staff made that a challenge but luckily we're a resilient optimistic group and continued to have a good time even though the staff never left and are even in the majority of the pictures that were taken through out the evening. So if you want to be bombarded with random rules and a cramping and hovering staff that will provide you with zero privacy and add stress to your visit then this place is absolutely perfect for just that.

UPDATE: All they keep saying is the same exact response in each review which is very poor management and not EVER reaching out to the customer! If this was my business and had MULTIPLE people saying the same thing then I would at least find out what is wrong and fix it. NOT GIVE THE EXACT SAME RESPONSE! And just an FYI.......there were more than 1 group that has complained about this and wish I would’ve taken a screen shot of the reviews BEFORE they took it down!

text: Phenomenal attention to detail, gorgeous property

text: Beautiful place, totally recommended.

name: Barb Linares
text: Our guild booked a retreat for March 26th - 29th 2020.  Due to Covid,-19 and the ages of our quilters, we have not been able to re-book our retreat.  The Lake House refuses to refund our money.

resp.text: Actually, this is a 100% false review. Your guild from Tallahassee is rescheduled for 9/23-26/21. We not only offered and tried to rebook you multiple times over the past year, but we also added on an extra day to your group at no cost to you. Covid-19 negatively affected everyone from our business to our retreat and wedding guests and we have done everything we could to rebook and accommodate everyone during such an unprecedented event. We would really appreciate if you'd remove this untrue review as it unfairly impacts our business but also reflects poorly on your guild.

name: Jeni Garcia
text: Absolutely the rudest place ever. Do not waste your money. If you want to be treated horrible, this is your place to go.

resp.text:
We are so thankful that out of more than 50 events in 2020, all but one wedding event was successful and the couples were wonderful to work with. We appreciate that the majority of our wedding couples and their guests have all been polite and respectful of our historic venue, especially in a stressful year such as 2020 due to Covid-19. At all but one of our weddings and events, guests have been willing to follow the safety rules and have been willing to work with our staff to modify their wedding plans to follow Alabama’s Covid-19 requirements. Our staff has worked very hard to still create safe and beautiful weddings even in a time that is not ideal. Only one wedding this year failed to communicate these requirements to their guests and, as a result, their guests and wedding party failed to follow our social distancing requirements and also broke our venue rules in regards to smoking and safe alcohol consumption. When our team has communicated these rules at all of our weddings and events this year, only one wedding party reacted poorly and refused to be reasonable and berated our staff.

All of our weddings receptions promptly end at 10:00 pm and all guests are asked to leave the property at this time. It is unfortunate when intoxicated guests react poorly to these rules but we are grateful that all but one of our wedding couples this year has communicated the contract and wedding end times successfully to their invited guests. It is also unfortunate that this particular couple did not bring any concerns to us during the event but rather their guests have chosen to spam us with dishonest reviews on various social media platforms. We love working with couples and brides and are confident in our reviews and ratings which are 100% 5 stars with the exception of this particular wedding event which broke our venue rules and has given an untruthful statement about our venue and our team. We look forward to the lifting of all Covid-19 restrictions in the future and our team continues to be focused on wonderful customer service.

name: Nathan Warner
text: As guests of a wedding we had a horrible experience with the staff.  They were rude and treated you like a child.  Only allowed one bathroom for more than 80 guests and even kicked people out of the house where the food was.  Very strange and unusual experience.  Do not recommend.

name: Katie smith
text:
This is the house of my dreams! It’s a beautiful historic home, and the lake is only a short walk (across a small street) away!

I especially loved the little details like the fresh flowers & the locally handmade soaps!

resp.text: Thank you so much Katie! We're so glad you enjoyed our stay with us, especially the small details that are so important to us, like our artisan goat soaps from a local soapmaker. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Samantha K. McDaniel
text: Hosted overnight guests - great accommodations!

name: Kristen Marcus
text: This is such a beautiful wedding venue!! They have an orchard, barn with a window wall (beautiful lighting), and a swing!! This was such a fun wedding to photograph at such a gorgeous venue!!

name: Karen Barr
text: My daughter's wedding was there. It is awesome!! The couple that owns it was very helpful throughout the whole wedding process. Would recommend them for any occasion.

name: Josh Harkins
text: Beautiful venue. Extremely nice and professional staff. Such an awesome place to have a wedding.

name: William Wilson
text: amazing place perfect for any event owners are so nice and so kind

name: Jana Turner
text: Very nice event venue. Pretty grove of satsuma trees. They provided a golf cart and driver to transport wedding guests from the parking area to the barn.

name: Timothy Reynolds
text: Attended wedding and reception here. Delightful place to begin married life

name: Perry Parsons
text:
Absolutely beautiful, great host and owner, did concierge service and valet parking personally due to the horrible weather.  Made what could have been a miserable situation a minor inconvenience through personal creativity. Hats off, will recommend without reservation to anyone wanting to book a venue for an event.

The only negative I can think of is, the acoustics were a bit lively for a 15 piece rock and roll band, but then again, most indoor places are, nothing out of the ordinary.  For a smaller group would be perfect.

name: Kenneth Dykes
text: Very nice and well maintained!

name: Sandi’s Crafts
text: Beautiful place for a wedding. I  went to 2 weddings 2 weekends in a row. I can imagine how pretty it would be for a fall wedding.

name: Kenyatta Harris
text: Absolutely beautiful

name: Tripp Summerlin
text: Super nice venue and the easiest people to do business with .

name: Deb Poloson
text: Best wedding venue I have ever attended!

name: Victoria Lester
text: OMG, how do I put it in words?!?  On January 04, 2018 we had the opportunity to have the most awesome, pleasurable wedding experience anyone could ask for.  Everything from the venue to the ceremony to the cake and the menu was exceptional!  The staff, I feel like I have made 3 awesome friends for life!  Everything was very professionally done and all we had to do was show up!  I highly recommend this venue and I promise you will not be disappointed!

name: Kathryn White
text: Southern House and Garden was a wonderful wedding and reception venue! Angie and Terri were a pleasure to work with throughout the entire process and the staff were very professional and accommodating. Our day came together perfectly (even with all of the rain). We would definitely recommend Southern House and Garden to any future newly weds looking for the perfect wedding venue!

name: Alyssa Smith
text: Angie, Terri, and Chelsea made all my wedding dreams come true!! I told them all exactly what I wanted and I did not have to lift a finger! I did not have to stress about planning anything from the time I picked the venue to wedding day!!

name: Elaine B
text: Wonderful place for a wedding.  It's beautiful and the reception food was great!  Staff is exceptional!

name: Emily Byrd
text: They gave me everything i wanted when I tried to describe my dream wedding. I dont remember much because the day went by so fast, but I have beautiful pictures of the beautiful flower arrangements, cake and decorations they created for me! They were very helpful and understanding about things I wanted for my big day, even if they were a little... different (tehe)! We had a short 5 month engagement, so we were very lucky to get a Spring wedding date AND having the stress of plannning flowers, catering, cake, decorating, AND cleaning up after off of mine and my mom's shoulders was a HUGE relief and SO worth it.

name: Chelsea Kott
text: Southern House is a beautiful garden venue that takes the stress of wedding planning away! The day of your wedding the family does not have to worry about anything except the gifts and leftover food!

name: Gary George
text: Best place to  have a wedding,  they  Did it all!!!.

name: CINDY MCCORMICK
text: Beautiful

name: Elizabeth McGee
text: The venue was very pretty!

name: Patrick McKane
text: Very nice setting for an event

name: Wood McGuire
text: Love

name: Christy Ruff
text: This is an absolutely beautiful wedding venue. The Bridal suite is amazing and the grooms suite is set up to keep them entertained while you get ready and is handsomely decorated. You can tell how much Love and thought the owners put into the details. And the owners are 2 of the nicest people you will ever meet.

resp.text: Thank you Christy!!!  We love what we do and the people we get to serve.

name: Brooke Sanford
text: Cindy and Bo are wonderful people!! They saved the day of my sister's wedding. They went above and beyond to make her day special. This venue is gorgeous and spacious! I would recommend Legacy and Serenity Farms for any wedding!

name: Scott Warnock
text: Super nice place and even nicer owners! Beautiful place.

name: Elisabeth Pendleton
text: Legacy at Serenity Farms is a beautiful wedding venue, and the kindness of the owners— Bo and Cindy Smith— makes it the most wonderful place to get married! I had my wedding here this summer, and Cindy was so helpful and generous with her time and anything else we needed. She also had a lot of decorations available, so we barely needed to buy anything to decorate (and the building itself is so pretty that it doesn’t need much decor)! Legacy was perfect and so was our wedding— give them a call!

name: Matt Remson
text:
After talking to Bo and Cindy for 10 minutes I could tell that they were not in the wedding venue business just for the money. Bo and Cindy are outstanding Christian people and it is overwhelmingly apparent that they LOVE what they are doing. The wedding experience they create is amazing and oh yea, the facilities are second to none. If you are looking for a clean, organized and quiet (unless you have a band playing) I would highly recommend Legacy at Serenity Farms. Thank you Bo and Cindy for an amazing experience and we hope and pray that you have continued success.

Matt,  Rita, Logan and Hannah Remson.

name: Jin Noh
text: Great venue. Very clean and plenty of room.

name: Kaitlin Bianculli
text: My good friend had her wedding here and we couldn’t have been more pleased! Beautiful venue and extremely helpful wonderful staff! Everyone was super nice and the venue was amazing! Super clean and well put together! 10/10 recommend for a wedding or any event!

name: Phyllis Runyon
text: Amazing and beautiful venue!!  Folks are great!

name: Briana Tompa
text: My cousin got married here this past weekend and it was a beautiful venue. Super friendly and helpful staff also! I would definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Brianna!! We loved being a part of such a special day!!

name: Dale Evans
text: Beautiful venue spacious inviting inside and out had a great time at the March  24th wedding  for Courtney and Blake would highly recommend!!

name: Emily Jenkins
text: Beautiful location. The owners are very kind!

name: m. Rainer
text: Best restaurant in the area!!!  The service here blows every other restaurant in town away.  Food is outstanding and changes with the local produce.  If you want a great meal and you're willing to pay just a little extra for the service this is the place to be.

name: Jimi Threet
text: I've been to Maestro 2300 a twice now. This place is amazing to say the least. The passion in the food is second to none. The ingredients in the food are fresh, complimentary to one another, and always well prepared. The presentation is like art on a plate. The atmosphere in the restaurant is classy yet warm and inviting. The staff are phenomenal, always eager to serve. A great place to take a date or even the family.

name: Jeffrey Chieppa
text: Had drinks and appetizers with the range and reef. Great music, great service, great food. Drinks were good.

name: Ben Boyd
text: Great food, impressive wine menu, excellent service. Perfect for special occasions or when you just want a fine dining experience.

name: Kevin Ellis
text: excellent food and service,  nice atmosphere, clean and relaxing.  Great place to have dinner

name: auburn phan
text:
Would NEVER recommend this place to anyone in Auburn. Me and my boyfriend got food poisoning from eating here. If you are going to spend that much don't spend that much to throw up and stay in the bathroom. Very disappointed.

Food poisoning occurs when you swallow food that contains bacteria, parasites, viruses, or toxins made by these germs.

- Now that is just gross. Clean it up Maestro 2300.

name: Mohammadnaser Ansari
text: You should try the filet burger. Definitely a top 5 burger in Auburn

name: Linda V. Russo
text: Wonderful menu and wine list, and outstanding service !

name: Lorelle Branham
text: The venue was beautiful and the service was even better. We couldn’t have asked for better service by the owners. Mr Dawson was always available from the day we signed the contract until the end of the wedding. He responded quickly to any needs and/or requests we had. You will not regret using this venue!

name: GARY CALHOUN
text: Great place to have a wedding!!!

name: Amy Scott
text: I attended a wedding here a while back and it was beautiful. It was a little hot upstairs but great otherwise. I commend the owner on standing by his beliefs.

name: Daniel Venable
text: We got married on October 12, 2019. We could not have been more pleased with our experience with both the owner and the building itself. The owner was so nice and was there to help in any way he could. Would definitely recommend Ava's Place!!

name: Holli Overton
text: Very nice place! Owners are very nice!

name: Carolyn Maness
text: Beautiful wedding venue.  Very spacious with seating for your guest and tables and chairs all included for the reception.  A covered patio now with additional seating.  This venue could be formal or casual.  Great!!!  The owner spends a lot of time  with you and is very helpful.

name: Kristy OLIVE
text: Beautiful venue and Mr. Dawson went out of his way to make sure my son and his bride had an excellent day despite the rain.  Couldnt have been better.

name: William Massey
text: This is a very lovely place for a wedding, family reunions, conference or other special occasion. The barn is a reclaimed barn that has been finished out just enough to make it elegant, without sacrificing its rustic appeal. With an auditorium on the main/upper floor, and a dining/reception area complete with commercial kitchen in the lower floor, everything you need for your special occasion can be found at one place.

name: Jay Humphries
text: Very nice place. Friendly staff members.

text: NICE BIT NO AC IT WAS HOT

name: Sharon Butler
text: A beautful place. The people who own it is the most sweetest people you will meet.

text: Beautiful place. The staff was not totally with it. The microphone was not on for half of ceremony. And several people got stung by bees

name: Gigi
text: Regarding the couple who were denied this venue because the owner discriminates against same sex couples...this place deserves negative stars. He allowed the couple to get their hopes up to have their ceremony here. Obviously, he didn't have the nerve to tell them to their face that he's a bigot. But when they called with the exact date he told them it's against his religion. I wonder if he allows anyone divorced to remarry here....isn't that also a sin in God's eyes? What kind of religion promotes hate and discrimination? Any form of bigotry is unacceptable.

Very nice people it was great
Working there for the week
