name: Kevin Smith
text: Gourgus place!!! Great service!!!

name: Nathaniel White
text: Danclay Farms is the perfect venue for weddings and events. The recently constructed chapel has fantastic lighting, plenty of windows, and is roomy. An attached reception room is well suited for events. Tennis courts and pool are behind the chapel, great for pre-wedding weekend activities.

name: Lucians Imaginary World
text: Wow, what a venue. The new addition is coming along. We are soo pleased to have this gem in florence Alabama. This l venue looks like something you find in a bigger city.  Can’t wait for the big day.

name: CONNIE BORING
text: A GORGEOUS event venue!! Incredible location!

name: Melanie Behel
text: As the venue is beautiful and well manicured it needs to be known that we were told the venue is home to some 20-25 free range cats daily and the  grounds are literally covered in cat feces, the flowerbeds smell of strong urine upon passing, and contrary to the contract that the animals will be placed inside during a ceremony there is no way to round up 25 cats timely. My daughters engagement pictures and  wedding pictures are full of cats in the ceremony, one cat literally walked down the isle in front of our daughter creating a laughing frenzy that took her aww moment from her as no one paid attention to her . One was cleaning it’s  bottom at the alter, some lying in food servers and eating off the quest tables and several dogs running thru the reception. We had  people holding cats under each arm to keep the cats out of pictures. The video of the wedding can not be heard over the barking of the rescue dogs and the owners personal dogs on the premises. The bridesmaids were constantly having to clean cat poop off their shoes. 🤢  The road to the venue is not paved and has become very rough as there is a large amount of logging going on around the venue at this time  (6-1-19). As I am an animal lover a formal venue is not the place to have a rescue and vice versa. There is only one bathroom for guest to use and it was not clean upon us arriving. I had to ask for it to be cleaned as it at hair around the urinal.  The inside of their carriage house which holds the kitchen had dirty floors and filth in the corners where it had not been cleaned well. I would not recommend this venue for any event which is formal or food being served. I also find it very interesting that any bad review on here can be challenged by a “google user” which is probably the owner trying to get their rating back up because if any of my family didn’t agree with me I can promise you they wouldn’t be coward enough to go on the Internet and post anonymously so there’s your proof they are pretty dishonest folks. And who would even care enough about one persons review enough to call them out on it 🙄 so come on “google user” throw your real name out there 🤣 and all anyone has to do to know I’m right is go out there and look and listen to all the animals.

name: Wicked Truth
text: Amazing venue, this place is absolutely gorgeous. Its like being at a palace.  Entering through a grand entrance.  Would absolutely recommend for wedding events.

name: Tanner
text: Gorgeous property, great amenities, and wonderful owners.

name: Jojo Rude
text: Very cute venue. My best friend's wedding was great. Loved the whole farmhouse look!

name: Hero Le
text: This is one of the most amazing places to be all year round. It's almost a hidden paradise if you're lucky enough to take a mini tour throughout the land, acres and acres of beauty.

name: Alice Arnold
text: Beautiful wedding venue! Gorgeous property. Owners and staff are very easy to work with and very eager to make sure that you have the perfect Wedding day.

name: Keith Lawler
text: Was invited to a friend's wedding.  I had never heard of this place and got more sceptical as we were driving out in the middle of no where and than all the sudden going thru the woods on a dirt road you come upon this massive rock walls and two huge wooden gates. WOW!!! what a beautiful place. I would highly recommend this to anyone having a outside wedding.

name: Haleigh Woodard
text:
This was by far the best experience I could imagine! I went to many different places, but nowhere made me feel as comfortable as Danclay Farms. The owners, Dave and Anu, are amazing to work with! They are so accommodating, and made the entire process as stress-free as possible.

It is such a beautiful venue with rolling hills, trees, pastures, and even a waterfall in the forest. I truly believe it is the perfect place to have a wedding or event. I would recommend Danclay Farms to all.

name: Windy Hood
text: AMAZING SCENERY!! Beautiful place for a unique, one of a kind wedding. Perfect for the bride who doesn't want what everyone else gets!

name: Dennis W
text: Lovely place for a wedding. Very Scenic.

name: Robert Pastuszka
text: It was beautiful! The property was well maintained and the landscaping was on point.

name: Mr. John Howard
text: Beautiful place.  My sister in laws nephew got married here.  It's a bit off the beaten path but worth the trip.

name: Brenda Allison
text: There was only one bathroom for all the guest and the event was totally outside with a heat index of over 100 and no fans to circulate the air. The venue was not ready to host a wedding or any other big event. There were people getting sick from the heat. Also, they ran out of drinks before all the meal was served. Would not recommend this place unless a lot of changes are made.

resp.text:
We are sorry for your experience . It is an outside wedding venue with a carriage house that has a kitchen and an indoor venue for 80 plus people  and three rooms for the bridal party and a living room

This  is mostly meant to be an outdoor venue as Advertised  and charms of outdoor  French estate and scenic views to  embrace. Carriage  house is fitted  with 3 air conditioning units (two main units and one powerful back up Fujitsu unit )  , which unless the bridal party turned one off by  an accident it gets pretty chilly in fact.

Danclay farms do not cater food so if u happen to not get a drink U might want to contact the event Cordinator or the caterer.

Sorry u had a bad experience. Danclay farms is  well equipped to handle large events with over 400 plus people  and have never had an issue . And there are two bathrooms in the property .

name: Patrick Clark
text: Amazing property!!

name: Annika Derham
text: Beautiful venue!

name: Faye Looney
text: Beautiful place

name: Jessica Chowning
text: My husband and I were videographers at this Venue and the staff at Bradford Farms were so pleasant to work with! I’ve never seen a wedding go so smoothly, they were well organized, on time and so helpful! Heather has so much experience and knowledge, she helped make our job easy! I highly recommend this venue!

name: Aubrey White
text: I cannot recommend this place enough!! Beautiful venue. Professional staff. They handled every detail flawlessly and made the actual day stress-free for this mother of the bride. Heather and Cecilia gave us WAY more than we asked for-from beautiful flowers arrangements and GORGEOUS pictures to details we didn’t anticipate, such as extra petals in the aisle. Additionally the staff on site were polite and accommodating to all of our guests, even a few of our more difficult guests. It honestly was the MOST BEAUTIFUL day and that is due to the awesome planning by Heather and her staff. Warning though: you will love them so much that they will become like family during this process and you will be a bit sad when it is over.

resp.text: We all cannot thank you guys enough for letting us take care of your precious family. Katy and Holden were a DREAM couple. We are sad it over but you guys can come see us anytime!!

name: Lauren Watkins
text: I can’t say enough good things about Heather and her team at Bradford Farm. They made everything so easy and stress free for me. I picked out everything I wanted and they completely took care of the rest (including cleanup). They truly have the wedding thing down to a science. Every one of her team members, down to the golf cart shuttle drivers were so sweet and helpful. Anything I needed, they helped make happen. My friends and family had nothing but good things to say about the venue and staff! Bradford Farm is a gorgeous, versatile venue with tons of beautiful ceremony options. I assure you, you will not be disappointed! Out of all the venues I have visited, this one takes the cake!

resp.text: Thank you Lauren! You and Geary along with you wedding party and family were the best ever. We truly appreciate that you let us take care of you.

name: Robin Mead
text: Wonderful venue, staff and service!  To say we were pleased is an understatement. Being from out of town we relied heavily on Heather to handle much of the planning and logistics and help to coordinate many of the vendors. The attention to detail was impeccable...resulting in a wedding day nothing short of perfection!! I highly recommend Bradford Farm. You will be treated like family and as if your event is their number one priority!

resp.text: Thank you Robin! So thankful that you guys chose us and that we have made a life long friendship through the whole wedding process. We love you guys!

name: Mariah Cantrell
text: Bradford Farms and Venue is truly a magical place to be married. There are so many beautiful options to tie the knot and I promise you Heather and her team will create any vision you have in mind! They work so hard to make anything you want happen, and are always so organized! I was just in a wedding here and it was amazing!  Weather was a huge factor right at ceremony time and her and her team flipped the ceremony site so quickly and efficiently without missing a beat! If you’re looking for a venue with beautiful views, great coordinators, florists, photography, and a crew with awesome personalities that are going to do everything they can to make your days better then choose Bradford Farms and Venue!

resp.text: Thank you Mariah!!

name: Katelynn Ferguson
text: Beautiful venue. Has options in case of bad weather. All staff members were very professional. They even helped out with my toddler during rehearsal and ceremony. Heather did an awesome job of making sure everything went smoothly for my sister’s big day.

resp.text: We love your entire family! Lily especially! She was a sweetheart. Thank you so much Katelynn.

name: Jewel Wade
text:
Very pleased and thankful for Heather and Bradford Farms. With Covid my daughters original wedding date had to be changed and Heather worked with her on making another date possible. It worked out beautifully!!! The open chapel made for the ideal background for my daughters vision for her special day and the reception hall was gorgeous. The entire venue is so spacious and beautiful.
More importantly Heather’s main goal was to ensure that my daughter had the best wedding day possible.
Whatever question or concern I had she was more than willing to take care of it. I’m very thankful to Heather and her staff!

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Jewel. It was an honor to take care of you all. We enjoyed the day with your family and hope that we get to spend time with you all again soon.

name: Juliana Coburn
text: Heather and her staff made our wedding everything we could have ask for and more!  The day was beautiful and made special even in the rain.  We had to go with our plan B because of rain.  Heather and her staff never missed a beat even though it was not our original plans.  We cannot say enough about how great this beautiful venue and staff made our day. Thank you Heather and staff

resp.text: Thank you so much sweet lady. We are so thankful that we could take care of you in every way possible. The rain never put a damper on the mood and we are so glad it was such a fun day. We appreciate you and your family for letting us be a part of such an important event in your life!

name: Sabrina Aday
text: Love this venue, I attended my friends wedding here I was asked to do their ceremony music... the ceremony was amazing in the trees and the reception hall was amazing.. Staff was great to talk with and resolved any issues without question.....

resp.text: Thank you Sabrina!

name: Gray Production
text: Oh my goodness this venue is the absolute best!!! Not only is it stunning but everyone who works there is so kind and helpful!! Trust me when I tell you this is the best of the best when it comes to venue!! The owner and photographer, Heather, make sure everything runs perfectly and truly cares about her couples!!

resp.text: We cannot say enough good things about working with you! So glad you were able to shoot here and we are ecstatic to see the video!

name: Tika Hunt
text: They should hire a better caterer! They fed their employees  off OUR food, let them take it home, and threw away the rest! ALL WITHOUT PERMISSION! So glad you THINK, that matters...  Your  comments hurt me not in the least. She apologized because she was afraid  she wouldn't get her pictures. AGAIN, I paid, I SHOULD'VE thrown it where I wanted. You are wrong, deal with it.

resp.text:
Ms. Hunt, yes maam we do in fact eat at events per our contract. I'm assuming that you expect my employees and other vendors who work tirelessly to ensure that your daughter's wedding day went perfect should never take a break to eat or drink. As an employer I try my best to ensure a great work experience along with providing all our guest service that is top notch.  We have a very close knit relationship with Southern Skillet and she always makes sure we are fed out of her own cost.

No one took any of "your" food as you are claiming. There are more than 10 employees/vendors at each event. Some of whom have worked 10 plus hours in the point that they actually get to sit and take a break during the reception. No one on staff eats until all guests are through the line and there has been plenty of time for any guest to get extra if desired. It is an absolute shame that anyone would think its unacceptable for another human being to eat or drink. As a matter of fact I got up and left what small plate I did have to clean up vomit that I am sure you knew nothing about.

All of the accusations you have brought forth have been addressed with your daughter. We cannot allow food to be taken when it has been out of temperature per health department regulations. We along with Southern Skillet ensure that all food is handled safely to standards that are set extremely high.

We did not meet or even speak to you until the day of the event, nor was your name on any invoice or the contract. So if you would have been a part of any of the meetings or wedding planning we could have explained everything.  We explained everything to your daughter and she was great to work with. I would even say a dream bride! She was nothing but kind and her wedding was a dream.

I have waited 2 weeks to reply to this due to not ruining your daughters honeymoon in which she graciously apologized for your behavior.

name: Sabrina Presto
text: Beautiful venue.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Carson Mead
text: The best venue with such an amazing staff!! Heather made our wedding day so special and memorable! Would highly recommend!!

name: Danyelle Richardson
text: Like many brides in 2020, Covid messed up our original wedding date and Heather was more than happy to work with us to reschedule... which actually turned out to be an even bigger blessing when the weather was horrible on our original date. I was able to bring all my stuff in and tell Heather and her staff what I wanted and they decorated and set everything up in exactly what I asked for. My decorations included important photos of my husband and I as well as photos of family and friends who had passed away; Heather and her staff took such care of them when unloading and loading back up. Her staff was friendly and willing to drive me anywhere I needed so I wouldn’t mess up my dress. One sweet lady even drove from the woods to the reception hall just to get me a water! When we weren’t taking photos, I was able to relax in bridal cottage— which is perfect with comfy chairs, a badass ring light for your makeup/hair person to use, an antique vanity for pictures, and private bathroom. The venue itself is so breathtaking. Every spot— the woods, chapel, reception hall— is designed from a photographer’s perspective, and on top of designing it that way, Heather even worked with my photographer (telling her the best time of day to shoot where) to ensure all the pictures of my special day were perfect. Our ceremony was held in the open air chapel, and once my toddler made it to the end of the aisle, she decided to take off into the woods😂 but one of the wonderful staff members drove her around on the golf cart to keep her entertained so my whole family could stay in the ceremony and so momma/bride wouldn’t stress out over a crying toddler. The open air chapel is like something out of a storybook. It gives you the feeling of being outside, but the stained glass and elegant front doors add a classic, “church” wedding element. I was blown away by how beautiful it is! Above all, I truly felt that Heather and her staff cared that I had the best wedding day. You only get to have one so I’m so grateful we chose a venue that went above and beyond to make that day PERFECT!

resp.text: Thank you so much Danyelle. We are so thankful for you and Josh and allowing us to take part in such a special day in your lives. You were a dream to work with along with all of your parents.

name: lisa allen
text: We had my daughter's wedding here on Halloween, and they did an amazing job!  Heather was terrific to work with. The decorations were beautiful and the food was delicious!  Her recommendations for DJ and someone to make my daughter's cake were great. I have had so many compliments on the venue and how beautiful everything was.  I have absolutely no complaints and highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you Lisa!! We enjoyed spending the day with you all.

name: Kyle Clayton
text: Great venue, very vendor friendly. Great people to work along with.

resp.text: We love working with the best there is! Thank you Kyle.

name: Austin Mann
text: Great venue and staff. Consider this site for your big event

resp.text: Thank you so very much! We are so glad you enjoyed it here. We appreciate the kind words.

name: jake maner
text: Couldn’t have asked for a better experience, everything was perfect! Britney and I couldn’t be more pleased and we highly recommend Bradford farms

resp.text: If there ever was as close to a perfect wedding you guys would be it! So thankful we were able to take care of you all.

name: Tyler Oliger
text: Staff was incredibly rude. We weren't allowed to bring beer for JUST the groomsmen without buying their special alcohol package. If it's a legal issue, I get that, but they were so rude about it. The guy literally called in security and said they would be watching the parking lot. The area for the groomsmen was very small and kind of gross honestly. Would never rent here again.

resp.text: As seeing as how it IS a legal issue. We never signed a contract with you MR. OLIGER or received and monies toward today's event . Therefore you sir never rented from us so there shouldn't be an issue with you renting here. You were told nicely by me, the owner then again by my husband who is the owner and he was very tactful. We appreciate the courtesy of the bride and groom along with their families who paid and contracted us to make sure their day was taken care of. We set a high stand here at Bradford Farm and take pride in all of our events. All guests are expected to abide by the rules set accordingly to the couples contract. We enforce those rules to make sure our paying and contracted couples are happy with the service that we provide from day 1.

name: Faith
text:
The venue was beautiful but the staff was unprofessional. There was some issue with one of the guests who ended up leaving a review with his complaint and instead of discussing the issue with the guest, the owner confronted him in front of guests, the wedding party, and the bride. It was very unprofessional and wasn’t fair to the bride. I told the owner that I didn’t appreciate her actions and she proceeded to get nasty with me as if I had anything to do with the initial review/ complaint. If nothing else, the owner should have discussed it with the guest who complained, and not in front of the bride who was just trying to enjoy her special day.

Also adding that the staff followed me to my car when I went out to get mascara because they were convinced I was sneaking to get alcohol (as if I’m a child) and then proceeded to make a comment/ question the religious sticker that was on the car. Super awkward and unprofessional. They also went into the bridal cottage and took the unopened bottle of champagne that we had in there(again, it was unopened and nobody was drinking it.) I just hope they didn’t go through anyone’s purses while they were in there without any of us having knowledge of them going in there.

resp.text:
Ms. Faith, in regards to what you call unprofessional behavior,  I did address the guest whom you are acquainted with. However it was not done infront of everyone as you said until you intergected yourself into the conversation. Your behavior and actions are the reason why there were issues. I will not be disrespected, nor will my staff or property. You brought in alcohol and it was very obvious you were drinking throughout the day.
Addressing the issue of your "mascara" trip along with the other 2 individuals at the car. You were attempting to sneak the beer we told them that was not allowed in. We heard the entire conversation and we could have asked you all to leave at that point.
There was no bottle taken from the bridal cottage, my staff was gracious and kind to you all day. No one took anything that belonged to you  nor did they touch anything as you are accusing them of. All completely untrue statements which I do not appreciate.
We have rules for a reason, and we do enforce those rules.

name: Danielle Duncan
text:
The best decision I ever made was changing my wedding venue from Lumberyard in HSV(horrible horrible place) to Bradford Farms. Words can not describe how perfect every single thing was for me & my husband on our wedding day. Heather and her staff are out of this world amazing. If I asked for it, they had it. If I called, Heather answered. I had the most amazing experience getting ready with my bridal party in the bridal cottage.
Within an hour of my ceremony, we had to make the decision on if we should move inside due to the rain. We did, and I'll tell you what, Heather and her team went out in the pouring rain, got all of our flowers and decorations and had everything reset up in the reception hall within minutes.  Noone would have even known we had plans to have our ceremony outside. I will forever be grateful for Heather and her hard working staff for making our wedding day absolutely perfect.

resp.text: Seriously girl!! We love the Duncans!!!! It was the best day and we are beyond blessed to have taken care of you all. The pictures will be amazing to share,the food was out of this world and those florals stole my heart! Thankful for so many amazing vendors who pulled everything together for the perfect day!

name: Mary Lovelace
text: I wish I could give this venue 100 stars! Heather is the best to work with! I had to change my venue and my plans due to the Corona Virus and Heather stepped in and made my reception possible! This was the least stressful process because she provides you with everything you need! My guests felt safe and comfortable inside her venue. The venue is absolutely beautiful and wish I could plan another event here! I would highly recommend this venue to anyone!

resp.text: We enjoyed hosting you all and it was truly  the best day ever! No stress, wonderful vendors and amazing guests. We enjoyed every minute and are sad that its over. We love the Berrens and Lovelace family!

name: Stephanie Crow
text: I had the privilege of being a part of a wedding at this beautiful venue and can’t stress how wonderful it is!  The scenery is lovely with multiple options for your event.  Facilities are top notch, wonderfully thought out, and clean.  Heather was easy to work with and readily available to answer questions and help with planning.  If you’re looking for a perfect place for your big day, check them out and book today!

resp.text: You worked your magic on the flowers! It was perfection!

name: Haley Willis
text: There aren’t enough stars for me to rate this beautiful venue. I was originally planned for another venue but due to COVID my plans changed and let me tell you that I’m glad they did. Just 4 weeks before my wedding, my venue had to be changed due to a change of guidelines and Heather was very welcoming on a holiday weekend to open her place for me to celebrate my marriage. Heather and her staff at Bradford were nothing short of amazing. They made sure everything was clean prior to our arrival, ushered us on golf carts around the venue, and were joyful people to be around. I highly recommend this place to anybody who is searching for the perfect place to celebrate their love for one another.

resp.text: We loved every minute spent with you guys. It was truly a perfect day!

name: Lori McGuire
text: We created a cathedral in the woods of Bradford Farms for my daughter's wedding that was nothing short of holy. Heather reassured us through the quarantine that she would do everything in her power to make it happen and there was not one detail left undone. The restrictions lifted just in time to send invitations. Our dream became hers and I have had so many approach me in the two weeks since to tell me it was the best wedding experience they had ever been a part of. We had over two hundred guests and everyone was made to feel welcomed, safe, important and celebrated. Heather is quick to respond to questions, her staff serves you with a smile and there is not a venue in the area with a prettier sunset. Our dream for the perfect day became Heather's dream and if I had it to do over again, I would not change a single thing.

resp.text: We cannot begin to explain how beautiful everything was. It was truly a perfect day and we enjoyed every minute spent with you all.

name: Sheri Carter
text: the atmosphere of the majestic woods and the elegance of the reception hall made a perfect wedding day for one of my son's best friends. the entire grounds are marvelous so glad to have been there!

name: Sawyer Sherrill
text: Nothing compares to the superlative atmosphere this location exerts. In all of Alabama, this is the greatest place to hold any event to your desire although it is specialized in weddings and receptions. Nonetheless, I recommend you consider investing your time to consider booking this venue.

name: Vicky Montgomery
text: Cannot say enough good things about Heather and Bradford farms, absolutely beautiful venue, with so many different options to have ceremony, beautiful bridal cottage, reception hall is amazing!!!  Heather and her staff are top notch!!! Heather is very talented my daughters flowers were beautiful and of course her photography is awesome!!

resp.text: Vicky we are soooo very thankful for you and your entire family. Your patience during a time of chaos and working with us to try and make sure we could provide everything as needed. Katelyn and Cody are some of the sweetest souls that we have had the chance to work with. August was a little delay from April but we couldn't have asked for more perfect weather and a day we all enjoyed and will remember for a lifetime❤❤❤ Thank you for trusting us to take care of you all!!

name: Andrea Lindholm
text: This is a Gorgeous venue! I am in the Wedding circuit and love working at this venue! Heather is amazing and so accommodating!  Love the bridal suite and the barn is like a fairytale. I would highly reccomend this venue!

resp.text: Thank you so very much!  We love when you are here!!!

name: Tony Dingler
text: This place is terrible. They will crawfish on what was agreed half way through the reception. They have security trolling around during the wedding hiding behind trees. Not very friendly. Seem to get mad if they see you having a good time. They want to start clean up before the reception is over.

name: Karen Posey
text: Simply perfect.

resp.text: Thank you Karen!!!

name: Heather
text: This place is absolutely stunning ❤️ And Heather is incredible to work with and so sweet ! I can not wait to have my dream wedding here in May ! Highly recommend this place!!! ❤️❤️❤️

resp.text: We are ecstatic to get to host you guys! Thank you for letting us play a part in your day.

name: jason Fields
text: Great Venue

name: Nina Lopez
text: What an incredibly amazing experience with Orange Beach concierge! They serviced a business meeting at a beach house in Gulf Shores. They provided a spectacular four course meal with clean up and smile! The food was delicious and we enjoyed the whole team! So excited to use them again!

resp.text: Hi Nina!  Thank you so much for the kind words.  It was so very nice to meet you all and we hope to be of service again soon!

name: Eric Jones
text: Orange Beach Concierge provided Gourmet to Go and a Personal chef experience for our spring break vacation with our young children.  After a long day at the beach with the kids, it was heaven to arrive home to freshly prepared meals at the exact moment we ordered them to be ready.  I highly recommend them for private chef and Gourmet to Go.  Great job!!

resp.text: Thank you for the Kind Words.  We look forward to seeing each of you next your are in Orange Beach!

name: Chelsea Madren (OC Food Diva)
text:
Bruschetta made with a balsamic reduction, tomatoes, basil, and garlic atop crostini. Fresh, juicy tomatoes burst with sweetness along with pungent garlic. The sweetness and acidity of the balsamic add another layer of flavor and fresh basil turns it up with herbaceous flair. Rating: 4.5/5

Brie and Marmalade Bites starts with a phyllo cup filled with orange marmalade, brie, and herbs. It is a light bite and would be great as a passed hors d’oeuvre for a wedding or corporate event. The creamy brie combined with the sweetness and citrus flavor of the marmalade pair perfectly together. Rating: 5/5

Caesar Salad is made with fresh romaine lettuce tossed with house-made Caesar dressing with anchovy. I love Caesar salad but it is very hard to find a place that makes it correctly. If you do not like anchovies, do not order a Caesar salad. It is just not a Caesar salad without it. Chef David makes a great Caesar salad dressing, not too thin and not too thick. The perfect viscosity to cling to the lettuce. I love that Chef David makes a crostini seasoned with butter, salt, and pepper instead of chunky, clunky croutons. It’s easier to eat and elevates the salad as well. Chef David, you need to bottle and sell that dressing! Rating: 5/5

Chicken Marsala is made with mushrooms, shallots, garlic, and parsley served over angel hair pasta. The chicken gently bathes in the sauce and really infuses the flavors into the chicken. It is tender and unlike any chicken marsala I’ve ever had. But that sauce is like liquid gold. It clings to the angel hair pasta like silk sheets. You can’t help but lick the plate afterwards. I could see this on a fine dining establishment’s menu. It is so refined and delicious! Rating: 5/5

Chocolate Fondant (Americans refer to this as a chocolate lava cake or molten chocolate cake) is basically a bi-product of a flourless chocolate cake and a soufflé. Chef David served his with macerated strawberries and strawberry coulis. If you go to my Instagram, I have a video of the chocolate “lava” flowing from the cake. I have tried many of these in my lifetime, but I think this was the best. I don’t know if it was because I had right out of the oven but it was just amazing! The perfect ending to a perfect meal! Rating: 5/5

name: George Weber
text: We had a personal chef evening with David and Tillie. The experience could not have been better, and the four course meal was awesome. They were prompt, professional and exceptionally patient with our slightly rowdy crowd. We can't wait to hire them again next year.

resp.text: George!  Thank you;  we appreciate the kind words and look forward to seeing you all again!

name: Claire Crawford
text: Trainers were nice and helpful. Made sure you had lots of fun. Wish you had more "fly time". Fun experience.

resp.text: Hey Claire;  as we appreciate all reviews that we receive, it appears that I am not familiar with your name and I believe you are referencing another company, as we do not provide services that have "fly time" nor do we have trainers.

name: Total Family Medical
text: Hired them for a private dinner for a friend. Exceeded EVERY expectation we could have had!! From the menu, the level of professionalism, the wine pairings. It was top notch. 5 stars across the board!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!  We look forward to seeing you again, safe travels home and until next time!

name: Megan kim
text: A nice stop but more notable for the great fried chicken in the main sandwich.  I didn't like the slaw and would opt for naked as well as skip the other menu items.

resp.text: Hi Megan, not sure that this relates to our company, as we do not table service and do not sell fried chicken in sandwich.  We wish you well.

name: Cindy Sasek
text: Always a pleasure to work with Orange Beach Concierge!  This is our second year ordering from the Thanksgiving menu. They are always so helpful and extremely friendly. We love just walking in and having this wonderful feast all ready to go for the next day.  Couldn't be happier, instead of being stuck in the kitchen I get to enjoy the beach and relax knowing the Thanksgiving meal has been taken care of and will be a hit with my family

resp.text: It was nice to see you both yesterday.  Thank you for everything and Happy Thanksgiving to you all!

name: TingTing S
text:
This company cancelled the catering for our event on the day prior to the event, without so much as a courtesy phone call.

We tried to use this service to book a private dining experience. We booked the date and spoke about the menu on the phone on 10-18 and received an invoice for the cost on 10-19. The due date on the invoice was 10-21, the date of the event. I tried to pay it on 10-20, but the invoice was already deleted and our event cancelled.

As per their policy, events must be paid in full 10 days prior to the event unless agreed upon in writing. Being that I received an electronic invoice with a due date of 10-21, I had believed this to be the "in writing" agreement that the policy referenced.

I had no reason to doubt the date listed on the invoice and the owner didn't mention anything else about invoice due dates during our previous phone call. Upon inquiry, they stated that the reason for cancelling our event was because we hadn't paid the invoice, despite it not being yet due. On top of this, they didn't have the courtesy of giving me a phone call to tell me that they cancelled, despite the invoice not being yet due!

This is incredibly inconvenient as it leaves me no time to find an alternative caterer.

Do not rely on this team for your events unless you are willing to tolerate a last minute cancellation due to their poor management and communication.

resp.text: We at OBC provided our guidelines and policies to the client multiple times, contacted the client via email and also via text to try and resolve.  We have also made a recommendation for an additional group to complete and provide services requested.  This is a very unfortunate situation.  We have not heard back from the inquiry and can only hope that she has received the services she has requested from our recommendation.

name: Babbette Rask
text: I called this bizness a few days before thanksgiving to inquire about ordering there thanksgiving dinner already made & hireing a personal chef for another occasion, instead of answering my questions she rudely answered back ( it’s on our website ) like I was bothering her by asking anything & it’s really bad for any bizness to have someone with no people skills answering your phone ; so anyways I said forget it and hired the beach club to do my thanksgiving ; but I thought I would write an honest review on face book and instead of trying to resolve the issues they applied back by defending her and insulting me ; so I will never use them and if you want a great thanksgiving with no cooking call the beach club 😀( and obv) train your staff ASAP.

resp.text: Your unfortuante comments have been noted and our position will always be to be kind.  Happy Thanksgiving to you and yours.

name: Dave
text: Great food.  Great Service.  See you guys next time we are in OBA.

resp.text: Thank you for the kinds words, we are so grateful for your business and we hope to see you again next year!

name: Stephanie Christie
text: Chef David and Tillie provide outstanding service and made our family holiday gathering not only special, but stress-free! The menu was well-planned, flavorful and satisfying without being heavy. The sweet potatoes turned my husband into a sweet potato fan for life! Orange Beach Concierge is a family favorite. Thanks David and Tillie.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for the kind words.  We are grateful.

Orange Beach Concierge

name: Susan 2 G
text: Chef's dinner for 50th birthday, dinner for 30 for parents' 75th anniversary, Gourmet-to-go mexican dinner is my favorite mex ever--we could go on and on. We are clients ourselves, and recommend Orange Beach Concierge to the guests at our big luxury beach houses. They make us look good!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, we are grateful to be of service!

name: Josh Story
text: We had a fairy tale wedding here! The venue and staff were great! Perfect place for events or watching the game!

name: Magan Dingler
text: 75 days till wedding day and Venue cancelled!!! I do not recommend this place anyone. It does not matter if you have paid a deposit...if they have any family members getting married they will cancel on you. They will tell you you have to move your day or find another place to get married!

name: Daniel
text: Do not use this venue!! My fiance and myself booked our wedding here one year in advance with a deposit paid 5 months prior. We was contacted yesterday which is 75 days from our wedding date by the owners daughter and informed that we would be required to reschedule our wedding or use another venue due to the owners Niece recently becoming engaged and insisted on being married on the same fate as ours. Flat out unacceptable! A years worth of planning and coordinating wasted. Not to mention our honeymoon that is already booked for the following Monday, wedding invitations already sent out with this venue and address on them. All events have been scheduled around our wedding date that was booked a year in advance and now is useless.

name: Jeremy Inman
text: Always enjoy watching a polo game here!

name: Heather
text: Nothing like being told by a venue 75 days before your wedding that you have already paid your deposit to and booked a year in advance that you will have to find another place to have your wedding all bc a family member of theirs got engaged a week ago and wants to have her wedding there on the same date as ours  , not to mention our invites have already been sent with the venues name on them ! Honeymoon booked , literally everything planned out! I’d give no stars to this place but that wasn’t an option !

name: anthony givens
text: ThI was at the Barkley cemetery which located in the proximity of the Polo Club. I don't think poor people will feel at home there , at the polo club.

text: Place is awesome just in general. Looks amazing and light up perfectly at night

name: David Faulkner
text: This place sucks!

name: Shelly Drake-Slaughter
text: I'm not sure where to start. The decor is outdated, there is limited parking unless you park in the grass. They double booked the date we agreed on for our wedding and they kicked us out at 10pm for a party that was supposed to start at 11pm. Mind you the guy who let us in was over an hour late so my wedding started an hour and a half late. I was very upset they had double booked my wedding date. Not only that. There isn't any space that you can get dressed in unless you want your groom or the guest to see you. From the beginning to the end of my wedding they had 3 different people who were "the building manager". The outside needs a major update as well. I hope since that day they have made tremendous changes/updates if not you won't be happy for your event.

name: Wendy McDonald
text:
My stepson and his new wife were married here about a month ago. This is a beautiful venue for a wedding and most importantly the bride and groom were very happy with their special day. The house and grounds are gorgeous and well maintained. The cottage behind the house that relatives rented was cute and seemed to have plenty of room for multiple people to stay comfortably. We had hoped to stay on the grounds as well, but the other rental was still pending inspections or approvals of some sort.

This location is a little out of the way of anything and doesn't have many choices for out of town guests to stay. Cell service cuts off out in the area, so make sure you have your map ready before you lose service.

resp.text: Hi Wendy!  I am not showing you as a registered guest with us.  May I ask why you gave us 4 stars please?  Are you sure you are reviewing the correct property?  Thanks!

name: Starla Roden

There was nothing that we needed that was not already provided. The attention to detail provided by Destinie made my daughter's wedding flawless. Thank you!

name: Patrick Steele
text: Beautiful venue...bathroom amenities could use some work.

resp.text: Hi Patrick and thanks for the five stars!  I didn't recognize your name right off, so I looked in all the reservations to see when you stayed and didn't see your name anywhere.  I can only assume you came as part of a group.  I was looking because I was wanting to respond to the comment but don't have chronology.  I wanted you (and the public reading this) to know that we have added two sparkling new full bathrooms on the main level and they are gorgeous.  The only other thing I could think of was the upstairs hall bath leaking to the lower floor.  We have discovered it only happens once in a while and in those cases the guests didn't put the shower curtain inside the shower.  So mystery solved AND we ordered glass sliding doors for that shower/tub combo to make it virtually leak-roof.  Hoping that clears anything up about "bathroom amenities needing work".  To the public reading reviews: this property is well maintained and we have no current issues with bathrooms.  They are all stocked with body wash, shampoo and conditioner.  We even have bar soap and the towels are fluffy and smell amazing.  Thanks Patrick for bringing the possibility of needing improvement as we strive to continuously achieve that.  Hope you will come back again.  Dave

name: Madison Justice
text: I got married here on March 16 of this year, and it was everything I imagined! Karla and Joe are so nice and helpful. They really go above and beyond to make sure everything is perfect for your big day. The venue is so unique and has so much character to it. Karla is so helpful and good at working with your budget, and she does not nickel and dime you for everything like other venues do! Karla is so sweet and you can tell she truly cares about your wedding and making sure it is exactly how you want it. We also did our engagement pictures at the venue and they turned out so good! The barn and their land is perfect for pictures. Thank you so much Karla and Joe for helping to make our special day so perfect! You guys are the best!

resp.text: Thank you Madison, your wedding was so beautiful, I loved working with you and your family, I’m so glad to have been a part of your special day 💕

name: Dona Bonnett
text: Shadow Wood Manor is one of the most beautiful venues to provide a romantic and rustic place for weddings or any other event.  This wedding venue in the heart of St. Clair County located in Moody, Alabama provides a rustic 4,000 square foot barn that truly meets elegance, not to mention the awesome covered bridge, beautiful landscape with ponds, fencing, trees and more for the most romantic wedding and engagement photos.  If you are looking for an elegant, rustic barn setting, this is definitely the right wedding center for you no matter whether you are looking for an outdoor wedding venue or an indoor wedding place.  Conveniently located just minutes from I-20 and easy to find...whether you are traveling from Birmingham or Anniston.  I have known the owners for years and they are a beautiful family.  This is their personal home and horse ranch that they have opened up to the public and it is just breath-taking!  Rustic truly meets elegance at Shadow Wood Manor Wedding & Event Venue!

resp.text: Thank you Dona :)

name: Captain Velveeta
text: This place is beautiful.  I D.J.'d a wedding reception there and the place is laid out perfectly.  It was typical Alabama heat in July but the inside stayed cold even as the wedding party and guests moved in and out of the reception area.  Plenty of parking, plenty of room inside and not so far out that you lose a signal on your cell phone.  The owners were very involved and super nice. They really made you feel at home.

Karla

text: Hosted our wedding at Infinity, and I truly cannot say enough good things about this venue! In addition to being absolutely gorgeous (which is a huge plus if you're like me and don't want to put a lot of effort into decorations...the venue is so beautiful by itself that we really didn't need a lot of decorations!), Aubrey and her team are truly a dream to work with. They were with us every step of the way to get us ready for the big day, and then they were there the day of to make sure everything went smoothly. My husband and I stayed in the honeymoon suite at the venue, and it was sooooo nice not to have to drive anywhere after the reception!  We got to hang out with our loved ones even longer! All in all, I would recommend Infinity to anyone looking for an even venue!

name: Casey Pridgen
text: Bubba's catered my wedding this weekend and I cannot say enough good things. Not only was the food amazing, the service was top notch. I truly felt like royalty. The servers came outside when we were taking pictures and asked everyone if they would like something to drink and came back with armloads of refreshments. Truly caring and professional people and far exceeded my expectations. My guests were all talking the next day about now amazing the caterer was! I would definitely recommend them to everyone.

name: Demetreus Taft
text: Bubba's catered our wedding 10/10/2020 and it was more than we expected! The food was beyond amazing..all of our guests were blown away. They even made sure that the groom and I had food to go. No complaints and I would definitely reccomend them to anyone!

name: Zach and Sam Tyler
text: Our wedding happened in the middle of the COVID-19 pandemic, which ultimately meant going from a 200-person wedding to a 20-person wedding. The team was so accommodating and helped us reimagine a menu that ended up so delicious. I can’t tell you enough about how wonderful our barbecue, mac n’ cheese, potatoes and fruit tasted. On top of that, Stephanie took extra precautions to make sure everyone stayed safe and well fed. I highly recommend.

name: Alison Chatham
text: Prep for the wedding and everything was great. Ray was a great coordinator and really helped us out a ton when understanding what we need for our wedding. I unfortunately have to lower the rating because two specific members of the staff were incredibly rude to us, especially my husband on our wedding day. They forgot to bring out our champagne for all 150 of our guests for the toast. They didn't have any of the cake ready for the guests, we had to awkwardly stand there with no cake for the guests. After both of those occurrences, one of the rude staff members pulled my husband aside and yelled at him for having a terribly scheduled wedding, even though we gave the staff the schedule for weeks early, which we followed. The bartender was very kind, but there were several times where the bar was left unattended and I was having to wait there with a ton of guests to get a drink.  There even came a point where the drinks were left for guests to grab themselves, and some of our guests were taking whole wine bottles... which didnt seem compliant with ABC rules. They did clean up very nicely though, which was very kind since we had to clean up the venue ourselves afterwards.

name: Janet Moore
text: 5-Star all the way!  Bubba's catered our daughter's wedding reception and everything went off without a hitch!  Professionals in every sense of the word; from our first meeting all the way through clean-up.  The food was wonderful and perfect.  We could not be more pleased with Bubba and his team.  A million thanks for absolutely everything you all did!

name: Kyle Hamilton
text: These guys work for you. I've used them for 2 events personally and was extended every curteousy an owner would enjoy. Their venue could use a little updating, but their personnel make up for it. I would recommend these guys to anyone looking to have almost any event catered.

name: Bob Stell
text: Large wedding - everything went perfectly.  Food excellent. Setup and cleanup no problems.  Good job!

name: Melinda Maxwell
text: Bubba recently did our daughter’s wedding.  As always, the food was wonderful and the service great.  Bubba and Josh go the extra mile to please their customers.  I have never seen a more hardworking, customer service oriented caterer.  The food display was also beautiful.  I would highly recommend them for any catering event.

name: David Phillips
text: If I could give negative stars to this caterer I would. I attended a wedding that Silver Spoon worked and the food was suitable only for a prison population and maybe farm animals. The roast beef was pathetic. It resembled cheap deli meat with canned brown gravy poured over the top. The chicken tasted rubbery and was dripping water. The salad was ok (if you like zero nutrition iceberg lettuce) but I'm almost certain they used Kraft store bought dressing. Hello!!! This is someone's wedding reception. Do you have no respect for your work? The food was completely unacceptable. I pray that the parents of the bride got a full refund.

name: Jamie Dodson
text: Great food, wonderful service and competitive pricing. Easy to work with, attentive to our details, and very friendly. Bubba's food was nothing short phenomenal!  Never had better Mac and Cheese or Chicken. The Pork was to die for as were the Brownies. We'll use him again for our next wedding.

text: BEST SERVICE AND FOOD EVER! they catered my wedding and everyone was amazed how good the food is!

name: kay sanders
text: We  had them cater our daughters wedding. We started a year in advance so we could save and get a good idea of cost. They told no need for this just come a couple of days before. Not very comfortable waiting so close I called and confirmed a month prier still trying to get a price. Two weeks before set up meeting to talk. They seemed put off by this but did it. Talked to Ray gave him our totals. He told us his likes such as guess would appreciate tubs of bottle water iced down sitting around sounded good we bought bottle water. He said bottle beer was better less waste so we went that way. He is the professional.  Still no price was set.  Going to e mail it ?  Then he said bring your stuff down two days before anything you dont want to mess with. They really dont mean that. we showed up it was like they had never done it before. We should have set up night before staff was lost.  They were suppose to chill wine and beer all was hot. They had no ice for tea cokes drinks ??? Food was good not sure why they stopped serving before all was feed. We found bags of food in kitchen left. Then the food staff was gone. The bar staff was great trying to deal  food staff was slow but did ok. Left oven on  found that. oh did I mention There was no Ray or Bubba ?? And NO ICE BROUGHT! This is what 3000 got us.

name: Lisa Bullington
text:
A month ago, our daughter was married at this incredible venue and we loved every part of it!! . After visiting many places in Alabama, she and her husband picked this amazing site, and we couldn’t have been happier! Living out of town, we were only able to visit once before the big day, but we fell in love instantly and completely understood why they chose this spot. Peaceful, surrounded by natural beauty, the need for extra decor did not exist. They have three well-planned areas for the big day - a bridal cottage with individual  bride/groom suites (separated by a small kitchen perfect for a pre-event snacking spot), the breath-taking “barn” area , beautifully draped with sheer white fabric and lights, for the “I Dos”, and a covered pavilion perfect for partying! A  well-designed, landscaped path connects all of it and makes the bridal entrance picturesque!  Angie, the owner,  was a dream to work with - answered all of our questions quickly and offered ideas and help along the way. We would 100% recommend this venue for any and all special events!

~morganleephotography

resp.text: Aww Lisa,thank you so much for the kind words!! You all were such a pleasure to work with as well!! Maggie and Joey are such a precious couple!! And getting to know you all was a blessing to us!! Thank yall so much for choosing Camp Creek for their beautiful wedding!!!

We also found that the price was by far the best around, especially based on what all you get out of it. The venue is absolutely beautiful with the barn, pavilion, and the cottage. The creek running by the barn was perfect for photos also! Angie and Steve were phenomenal to work with!! They made everything so easy and were so very helpful! If I had to do it over again I would choose Camp Creek a million times over! I highly recommend you checking this beautiful venue out, you won’t regret it!!

name: Teri Easterling
text: Our daughter selected Venue 3131 for her wedding and reception. From setting the date in June 2020 through the wedding day 6/26/21 the staff has been responsive and helpful. The studio opens up, and strategically placed fans kept us comfortable as the sun went down. They give access to a room full of decorations. Daughter opted to leave some of hers, so the staff handled take down for us. Rehearsal dinner set up was in the arbor terrace that was quite pleasant. Chris and Holly and crew are excellent! I have attended some other events there that were well done also.

Hi Teri, thanks for posting some photos from your daughters wedding.  We were fortunate to be able to work with her and Tyler and this wedding was so fun and unique!  WE LOVED IT!

text: Venue 3131 is amazing!!!!! We had our wedding here a few weeks ago and all I can say is wow! Chris and Holly were great to work with and helped us so much throughout the planning process! We had different venue booked but they canceled on us with 2 months to spare. We came across Venue 3131 and they swooped right in and saved the day! I keep saying that we ended up way better off in the end. Every staff member was so attentive and caring and the venue is truly beautiful. Our wedding weekend was absolute pure magic from rehearsal dinner to send off. We can’t thank Chris, Holly, and staff enough! Seriously if you’re needing a venue for any event Venue 3131 is the place to go!

Thanks again for the review and we hope to see you two again in the future!

text: From the beginning to the end, our experience in working with The Owls' Landing was AMAZING! The owners are wonderful to stay in touch and communicate important information. If you are looking for a wonderful venue at a reasonable price in a beautiful location, please consider The Owls' Landing.

name: Ashton Bailey
text:
Working with the family at Owl's Landing was honestly a dream experience.  We booked them during the Valentine's Day special they were running in 2019 for our June 2020 wedding.  I never had any issues with them; they immediately responded to my messages and put all fears at ease when I had them.
I was most blown away by how much they truly seemed to care about my then-fiance and myself as people, not just as a couple giving them money for a wedding.  When Elena and Owen would happen to stop by the restaurant I worked at, they would always make a point to come say hello to me.  When sharing news on social media, they were usually one of the first to wish me congratulations.
When we had to unfortunately downsize our wedding to less than 10% of what the original capacity was, they were so supportive of our decisions. The worst I felt when cancelling my "dream" wedding was knowing that I couldn't celebrate with this amazing family whom I began to feel really connected with over the two years we've known them.
This venue and the people that run it are a dream, and they are the only ones I truly recommend in this area with no doubt in my mind.

name: Tangy Bodie
text: My husband and 3 others drive over 1 hr to play this course. When they got there a lady was working the club house. They informed her that they had reserved a tee time at 12:30. She was soooo nasty to them. She threw her hand up to cut them off and informed them that there were no carts available for 30-40 mins. The guys were ok with this since they would hit the driving range up in the meantime. It was her holier than thou attitude that made them mad. The owner was contacted and he defended her saying she sometimes comes off as rude, he did however go speak to the men and offered them a Gatorade as compensation... Yes will deff not be back! But they did say the course was nice.

resp.text: The real story of this review is that Tangy Bodie whatever her name may be, wasn't even at the golf course.   This is more of a story of how she can attempt to extract extreme compensation for the threat of a bad review.  From the moment speaking with Alexis on the phone the conversation quickly became "what kind of compensation will you give me??"  Meaning she wanted me to refund over $ 160.00 in greens fees because of her threats of a poor review.   I went out to the course and spoke to the gentlemen about the incident.  They were delayed only 5 minutes from their tee time.  My worker could have had a cooler head dealing with customers, but an apology was made and the men appeared to be happy that I looked into the situation. I offered to buy them a round of beers as a friendly gesture.   I am more than willing to accept a one star review than cower to a person trying to extort money in lieu of a bad review.   Cumberland Lake GC is one of the finest golf courses in Birmingham at its price point.  And, we also have some very fine individuals working behind the counter.  Please judge for yourself.

name: Zanthia Rodriguez
text: I just had my wedding at Blount Springs Chapel, and it was absolutely gorgeous! The location is beautiful, and the owner is very prompt and helpful. If you are looking for a small, dreamy wedding in the woods, Blount Springs is perfect. The Chapel itself and the staff are great, definitely 5 stars, but there are a couple things that were a little inconvenient. One thing is that there is not a good place to get ready. That wasn't a problem for me- I only had one bridesmaid, and we did everything except getting dressed, elsewhere. Also, the reception area doesn't hold everyone, so we had to set up tables outside. Those things didn't detract from the wedding for us and our friends, but it's something to keep in mind. If you are wanting a small, beautifully aesthetic wedding, this is the place! It was perfect for me and what I had dreamed.

The most beautiful, intimate, elegant venue for a wedding!

The chapel was beautiful and the reception downstairs that followed could not have been more convenient. The caretakers are the most accommodating people you will ever meet.
As you can tell from this lengthy review, You need to "come and see" for yourself!
We made lasting memories here, NEVER to be forgotten!

name: Stacey driver
text: My daughter, Summer and her husband Will were married at Adams Acres in February of 2020. They were one of the first few couples to ever be married there! This venue is the absolute best! It is located on private property in a secluded country setting away from high traffic areas giving you a serene and peaceful setting! The sunset pictures at Adam’s Acres are a must because I don’t think you can get a more picture perfect setting. The rustic decor and set up inside and out also make for the perfect background for pictures! The owners go ABOVE AND BEYOND to make your special day perfect!  From the first walk through to the final minutes of the wedding day (clean up time) Brittney Adams, her husband, and their wonderful tribe of helpers were the most gracious and supportive hosts! Brittney and I kept in constant contact from the very beginning! She gave me so much helpful information from how to set up the venue to the best priced insurance coverage to use! She made the stressful things that people don’t always think about when it comes to wedding planning extremely easy! The day of the wedding when we were still decorating, she and her her husband were there willing to move things around, hang things, decorate things, and even loaned us an industrial steamer for the bridesmaids who forgot to steam their dresses beforehand! From beginning to finish  Adams Acres made the entire experience an absolute beautiful memory for everyone involved! We can never thank them enough for making our youngest daughter’s wedding dreams come true!

resp.text: Their wedding was so stunning! Every detail was absolutely perfect! The best part was getting to know you guys! Y’all are so genuine and fun! We had a blast celebrating your daughter!

name: Madison Ingram
text:
I would not recommend this venue if my life depended on it! Do not sign a contract with Adam’s Acres, and do not trust them. Adam’s Acres has been operating for less than a year. I was the first bride to book Adam’s Acres. I booked them when all that Brittany Adam’s had to show was studs and pictures of what it would look like when completed. I took a huge risk and trusted Brittany. Now, I regret that decision.

Due to the COVID shutdowns in March, I was forced to postpone my April wedding. All of the dates I had to choose from included holiday dates or August dates. We picked August 15th thinking that COVID would be over by then. However, COVID-19 cases are worse now than they were in April. After a lot of praying and talking to relatives, a month from our wedding, we made the decision to postpone our wedding again! This is not at all what we wanted to do, but for the safty of our family and friends we felt it was necessary. Brittany, being the heartless person she is, refused to give us another Friday-Saturday date in 2021. She offered a Sunday date with our rehearsal dinner being on a Thursday. That would not work for religious purposes and the fact that we have so many out of town guests.  She said “we would cut into her 2021 revenue if she gave us a Friday-Saturday date”. The only way we would be able to have a Friday-Saturday date is to pay the new 2021 rate of $3500.00 when we have already paid in full of $2500.00. Not only will she not let us postpone to a Friday- Saturday date in 2021, she refuses to give us a refund.

She has stolen our money and has taken advantage of the COVID-19 situation!! Do not book here!! Check out Magnolia Bay, Serendipity, Windmill Station, or The Grand!! Stay clear of Adam’s Acres and Brittany Adams!! Learn from my mistake!

resp.text:
We are so sorry that we were unable to find a compromise that worked for both parties after your cancellation. COVID-19 has been a nightmare for everyone and we understand your frustration.
When the State of Alabama shut down all businesses we rescheduled affected couples. It was heartbreaking for our couples and incredibly difficult for our small business that had been operating less than 6 months. We were so happy to have Fall dates still available, but we will be very honest...it has been difficult trying to recover from all the bookings we lost because of reschedules, especially when we didn't qualify for any assistance. We are thankful that unlike a lot of businesses we were able to survive and didn't have to close our doors.
When we rescheduled you to August 14th/15th, we held that date for you and turned away other couples and parties that contacted us for that date. Unfortunately when you cancel 3 weeks prior, it is impossible to re-book.
We have been open and safely hosting events again since May 30th. Every single couple has been dealing with the uncertainty of COVID and taking precautions to keep everyone safe. We offered to discuss these options with you as well. The mother of the bride tonight told us, "I know it wasn't as big as they planned, but they are finally married and we felt SAFE." Yesterday’s couple rented additional tables to put outside to further socially distance. All weddings have provided masks and had hand-sanitizer readily available. Tonight's bride also live-streamed her event so that her grandmother (who could not attend because of her assisted-living's COVID policies) could watch her get married. Vendors are wearing masks, caterers are hiring extra staff to safely serve everyone, our venue has extra staff at events for sanitizing... Everyone is making compromises and working hard to keep everyone safe.
We are in no way downplaying the seriousness of this virus. We also have no idea when it will end. We understood the reason for your cancellation and although it goes against our cancellation policy, we were empathetic and offered you a Sunday date in 2021 with no additional payments required. When you told us that interfered with your religion, we again offered for a Monday-Thursday. We are so sorry that none of those options worked for you.
Weddings are such an emotional time for everyone and we understand your disappointment. We know that all couples and wedding vendors alike have been thrown into incredibly difficult situations. When what you want to do for your couples conflicts with how you have to run your business--it feels impossible. If we let one person reschedule, we would have to do it for everyone to be fair. We are so sorry, but we simply cannot do that and keep our doors open. We have to follow our cancellation policy in this situation.

name: Yaak18
text:
Updated to include Class Action Lawsuit contact information!

My Daughter scheduled and paid for a wedding. Due to Covid shutdowns ordered by the Alabama Government,  the wedding could not be performed.  It wasn’t my daughter’s fault and it wasn’t Adams Acres fault.  In this case a reasonable person, in other words,  not a crook, would refund the deposit (full payment of $4000) to my daughter.  The owner, Crooked Brittney Adams,  refused to refund the money.  Her contract is iron clad to screw the customer no matter what happens.  She claims to be a Christian and puts off a wholesome,  caring demeanor but In my opinion she’s a scammer just like so many in today’s world.  Don’t trust her! Do not sign a contract with Brittney Adams and don’t give her any money.  She will steal it from you.

Update:  I have been contacted by other disappointed customers of Adams Acres and we are planning a Class Action Lawsuit against this fraudulent business.  If you have been victimized by Brittany Adams please send us an email at AdamsAcresClassActionLawSuit@gmail.com

We have a Dothan Law Firm ready to proceed.

Thank You.

resp.text: We are so thankful that out of the 9 brides affected by COVID at our venue, 8 have them have successfully been rescheduled. Two of those rescheduled weddings have already occurred at our venue since the restrictions were lifted. COVID has created such an unprecedented set of circumstances. While it hasn't been ideal for anyone, we have had open and honest communication throughout the process. Only 1 bride out of those 9 affected refused to communicate with us via phone and requested that communication be only between our attorneys. We honored her request. All brides affected were offered comparable Saturday dates and we even offered to extend those date options into 2021 if they still desired a Spring wedding. For those who were in school-- they were offered dates while school was not in session including dates during the Summer, Fall break dates, Winter break dates, and of course Spring 2021. We always try to work with our brides and their families and will continue to offer alternative dates for the 1 bride who has not yet rescheduled. We know that trying to plan a wedding during COVID has been very difficult and we are here to help with that process as much as we can.

text: Olivia and Benjamin are the most kind, genuine people I’ve ever met!! It was such an honor to have them shoot our engagement session and our wedding. text: My husband and I **highly** recommend Olivia Joy Photography! Having a stepdaughter that doesn't like to dress up makes taking traditional family photos difficult. resp.text: Rosemary, thank you so much! I loved every moment with your family and hope to continue taking your family portraits throughout the years. I sincerely had such a great time with you and yours! Have a great Thanksgiving!

name: Shelby Smith
text:
There are truly no words to properly thank Olivia and Benjamin for being the most wonderful additions to our wedding day, and also during the weeks leading up to our day during Covid. Olivia and Ben blew it out of the park, and I have such a critical eye for photography! They were absolutely PHENOMENAL. From their attention to detail and their willingness to go out of the way to get every single picture you could possibly want - I firmly believe there is not a better wedding photographer in Alabama. I have looked at hundreds of photographers all varying in prices, and none of them had the quality of images, consistency in editing, and photography style that she has. She was so organized, on top of every detail, and there for every moment I needed her. She also led me to several of my other vendors, who were all fantastic as well. I honestly just feel so overwhelmed with happiness looking at my wedding album! She also delivered my wedding album four weeks early. This woman is a saint- and so is Benjamin, her wonderful husband. Do yourself a big favor and hire these two. I will use them for every event in our lives go forward. Family pictures, future weddings and events, birthdays, you name it. I just wish I would have found them sooner!
Thank you for leaving me with the most beautiful images to document all of our memories. You will forever be family to us!

name: Suzanne Butler (Where2Golf)
text: Nestling in a valley between two ridges of tree-covered hills, the up-market residential development of Limestone Springs can boast a championship golf course that is a delight from first to last. With unobtrusive villas skirting only a few holes, the course retains all the naturalness and tranquillity of this Appalachian foothills environment.

name: Chris Mahan
text: This is a beautiful place with upscale environment and friendly staff. They were incredibly busy, but made me feel like I was the most important person in the room. I don't play golf, but am seriously considering picking up the sport just to have an excuse to come back here on a regular basis.

name: J L
text: The overall experience was a bit of let down because I had heard so many good things about this course. I traveled more than an hour away as well as the friends I invited and was pretty embarrassed by the conditions of the greens. I could see how this place would be beautiful if it was well maintained but every green had some sort of sun damage or grass issues. The temporary greens were not even cut so it was as if you were putting in the rough. The water coolers had no ice and we never once saw a cart asking if we wanted anything. Im writing an honest review so that others won't have the same bad experience that I did. I hope they fix things because the overall scenery is beautiful

name: T Garrett Neill
text: Mixed feelings.  At one time, one of the top courses in the state, and certainly my favorite.  Played today for the first time in a while, and although the course is nice, it is NOT the experience and condition that it once was.  It appears that they are working hard, but the edges are a bit rough.  Greens good, but slow.  Carts have been allowed to go almost anywhere.  It's a bit like the local good ol' boys have taken over.  I played behind 4 groups of 5 apiece, playing their own ball.  Took about 4:40 to play 18 as a single.  No chance of playing through or an offer to.  Should not have 5somes.  Staff was nice, decent food.  Fortunately,  I came on a Monday for a $50 rate.  If it was weekend it would have been $90!  Tough to justify driving an hour from Hoover.  I will play here again, but not motivated to try again quickly.

name: Noah Kess
text: What a beautiful venue! My band played here yesterday for a wedding reception. The grounds were beautiful! It was a very easy load in, the staff were very helpful and professional, and the event went off without a hitch! The food was great, not sure if that was in house or not, but the bars, which were in house were well stocked and attended by great tenders. The decor was modern while still having a traditional southern feel. All areas outside were well lit, and had great coverage from the sound system. Plenty of clean bathrooms as well. Of course we couldn't use it but the infinity pool and hot tub looked very relaxing! There also was a fire pit built into the ground with seating around it. Couple all this with pristine views of the Appalachian foothills and you have a wonderful wedding venue!

name: Caley Clark
text:
Does not work very well with brides being affected by the pandemic. I understand that everyone has gone through hard times during COVID-19, as it’s something no one could have planned for. But I do feel like a wedding venue should be willing to compromise with a bride when she is unable to use dates they give her. I fell in love with this venue and the owners and recommended them to everyone, but with the outcome we have had, I will not be recommending them to anyone else, in fear that someone else will lose thousands of dollars when the venue says a pandemic falls under “acts of God”.
Refused to refund us even a portion of our money after our family could not use one of their dates available due to a PANDEMIC and the fact that my FIL is a football coach with a very tight schedule. I would also like to point out that when we booked the venue, I booked through the owners. An employee was hired a few months after to handle the wedding side. I loved the personality of the owners and how kind and relatable they seemed. I do not feel like I dealt with a person with the same qualities when we were met with the tough decisions of rescheduling twice and then eventually not being able to have a wedding at our dream venue at all.

resp.text:
Caley, we have all been affected by the pandemic and we appreciate your frustration.  We made every attempt to work with you and you even selected an alternative date saying “you can write it down in stone. ”  That was not restricted by any federal or state limitations and was not during football season. You chose not to use that date and gave us no notice.  We relied on your acceptance of the date and were not able to offer that date to other brides or new weddings.  We, nor the pandemic canceled your wedding.  Lastly, our staff has both impeccable experience and character and made every attempt to accommodate you.  We are truly sorry about the end result as we were looking forward to hosting your big day.   We are sure you were a beautiful bride wherever the event was held.

Kind Regards, Frank Brown

name: Brian Kitchens
text: My fiance and I were so excited to be getting married here. Our wedding was scheduled for March 28th. Unfortunately, the state mandated no gatherings of 25 or more people and we needed to reschedule. We were offered a couple of other dates that did not work with the schedules of everyone else. Southern Charm advised us that "maybe we shouldn't be so picky." It was evident we needed to change venues. Southern Charm would not return our deposit of $500 over something that was no fault of our own. It is not as if our cancellation prevented them from renting the facility to another. I'm extremely disappointed to see this behavior during times like this.

resp.text: We sincerely regret that you were disappointed with our efforts to please you and your fiancé. We fully recognized the extenuating circumstances caused by the current corona virus mandates and have worked with each of our clients to shift dates and assist with rescheduling for happier days ahead. It was because we knew the circumstances were beyond your control, just as they were beyond ours, that we DID choose to extend a refund of your $2000 rental fee, despite it being contractually non-refundable with your cancellation being so close to your reservation date. We felt it was a kind response and the right thing to do. We further offered to allow you to apply the $500 non-refundable deposit toward ANY “OPEN” DATE in the future. That offer remained extended. We are incredibly sorry if someone made the remark you mentioned and can only imagine it would ever be said as a poor attempt at humor under stress. Our employees are wonderful people, but there is certainly nothing funny about the times in which we find our world right now. That being said, we still hold hope for a brighter tomorrow for everyone, and we continue to welcome you to find an alternative open date to book Southern Charm for your needs.

name: Savannah Blake
text: Beautiful and elegant! We loved it! Pictures turned out great and it was just wonderful! The only complaint is that it was hot. The walls had gaps in the wood which I'm sure added to the aesthetic but it was very warm even with the air full blast

resp.text: Thank you, Savannah! We are delighted you were pleased. We do apologize for the temperature issue you experienced. As you noted, the barn style is part of our aesthetic, and we are one of the few barn venues who have heat and air. Even so, we appreciate your feedback, along with others, as we do have plans to insulate and add more wood to the walls to help with temperature for the comfort of future guests. We appreciate your review and hope you’ll share our venue with your friends!
