name: Cassie Houck
text: This venue is gorgeous, however when booking you need to be aware of a few things. The kitchen is tiny, so if you are more in to doing it yourself or booking with a small caterer, you might want to look elsewhere. We were some of the first people to book, so they were a little disorganized. We didn’t have a contract, and they promised several things (including getting the night before to decorate since we were getting married on a friday) that were not fulfilled. And on top of that, they did not make any notes about the 50% discount we were promised, so after the wedding, they continued to hound my family for a check that was already cashed. I am giving 3 stars because it was beautiful, but we were dissatisfied with the way the owners handled a few things. I am hoping they have changed these things over this past year because it is a beautiful place to get married! If you do end up picking this place or any venue, make sure you have a paper trail with all of the things that they are promising you!

Had to confront quite a good many stairs, that, were hard because of being narrow and steep! Staff was warm, friendly and courteous! A family atmosphere! I noticed an out building, more specifically a nice big red barn that would be perfect for more fun casual functions! Being a retired cowboy, it got my attention, but, never got too close so I can't really say much about the interior!! Last, but, not least , needed more reliable marking and signs leading to the venue.....no one wants to be late!!

name: A Jett
text: Beautiful venue, sadly the staff ruined the experience. The day before our wedding, at the rehearsal, they changed the time that we could arrive and made it an hour later. This was a problem especially because our photographer was scheduled to come at the earlier time. He came when they allowed but we were not able to get as many pictures. Their wedding planner called the day before the wedding to discuss details for the first time. That is something that should have been discussed way beforehand. We had our own wedding planner but were required to use theirs as well. I had hoped for one type of flower but since it was unavailable I chose roses. 2 weeks before the wedding the florist called to tell me the other flowers were available but when I called her back my first AND second choice were no longer available. I ended up choosing something random since it was so last minute.  The cake was beautiful and perfect so there is that redeeming quality. I would not recommend this place due to the attitude of the staff members. Though we had all of these minor things going on, my wedding day was more than I ever dreamed. That didn't have anything to do with the venue but had to do with what marriage represents. Thankfully our vows were much more important than everything being perfect. I wish my family had not forked out so much money though because it certainly was not worth what we paid for.

resp.text: NOTE: This review was made prior to new ownership taking over in 2021.

name: Sharon Iwasa Perkins
text: Just had my granddaughter’s wedding here. She’s a fan of the Keira Knightly Pride and Prejudice movie, and when I saw the chandeliers in the barn (see photo), I saw why she chose this venue. It was perfect. We had approximately 125 guests in attendance, and we fit well in both the ceremony and reception areas. While the weather was sunny and hot, they cranked up the AC in the barn. Also, my granddaughter had fans printed up and passed out, so people were fanning themselves throughout the service in true Southern style. After the ceremony, we walked across the gravel road to the reception area, and dined under the wide open blue skies. Fireflies danced among the rose bushes as evening softly surrounded us, and the stars and twinkle lights added to our celebration. Of course, my granddaughter’s father-daughter dance music selection was the opening theme song of the movie, “Pride and Prejudice.” Then, the DJ put on the latest dance music, and the crowd of twenty-somethings danced the night away. The food and bar offerings were greedily devoured. I found the J and D staff kept our needs met unobtrusively but also with a sweet spirit. We just loved everything about this wedding, and it location was a large factor in our celebration. We’re very grateful.

name: John Traylor
text:
Went to J & D Farms to attend the wedding of some friends. It was very hot, though I obviously don't knock the location for that. My main complaint would be that they had to move the chairs from the ceremony area to the reception area. This took about 20 minutes, and left all the guests standing confused in heat. No one came to tell us when they were finished setting up, and we eventually meandered up to the barn where the reception was held. There were also quite a few chiggers (red bugs), at the barn as well. Perhaps this all wasn't to their fault and was resultant of poor planning, though it seemed as though it was.

The parking was also odd, it was about a quarter of a mile from the venue. They had transportation between places in the form of what was basically a golf cart. Though they took forever to come back and forth, resulting in my girlfriend walking up the hill in heels.

Overall the place was quite beautiful, I hate to give this sort of review to such a lovely place, but this was my experience.

resp.text:
Hi John,
Thanks so much for your review and the kind words about the overall beauty of our venue. In regards to the seating in the orchard... we actually have multiple seating options available that do not require seating to be moved from ceremony to the reception. We have over 300 chairs, vintage church pews as well as custom made wood benches. In this case it was requested that the same chairs be utilized at both, ceremony and reception, so we did in fact have to move them... which is a job that  requires about 20 minutes and 6 staff members. We do strongly discourage this option, but ultimately it’s the decision of the bride. :-) As far as instructing guest to make their way to the barn, this would fall under the job of a wedding planner or coordinator, not the venue itself. In regards to chiggars, we do keep all gathering areas around the barn and reception area mowed and well maintained, however we do have 40 acres of Bermuda surrounding the barn, so if you got in any of these areas, a chigger or two is very likely :-). Finally, our parking lot is located on site but 600 feet from the barn. We do this as an effort to keep the ceremony & reception area safe, as well as clear of vehicles for photography purposes. A 6 seater electric (2017 Polaris Gem) shuttle is available for all weddings. The round trip for this takes only 90 seconds, of course that time does vary..  Especially when exiting, as we make every effort to drop guest directly at their car.  Again thank you for the very kind words. We hope you get the opportunity to attend another wedding soon!

name: Megan Hoehn
text:
ABSOLUTELY PERFECT WEDDING DAY!!
When looking for a venue in a town we were unfamiliar with, finding Yolanda and her staff was a god-send. We wanted to avoid the "wedding nightmares" you hear about with vendors falling through or ripping you off or all of the above and we chose wisely. We visited the venue and after meeting Yolanda, we immediately said “this is the one”. We looked no further and this is the only venue we visited. It is as beautiful in person as you see in the many photos on their website and in other bride's pictures. I cannot wait to get our pictures/videos back. It is a family owned business and quite reasonable in the grand scheme of average wedding costs. We had unlimited contact and visits with all staff. We moved to the south a year before getting engaged and decided to have everyone come down to us for a good ol’ southern wedding. The logistics were overwhelming and Yolanda, Candace and Terri were wonderful in making sure everyone was picked up, transported and generally accommodated. They take care of all the major details so for a detail-oriented person like me, it was great because I had time to craft my own little personal touches. We rented out the mansion for the immediate families and wedding party to spend the night with their guests and when we pulled up, we got nothing less than Ooos and Ahhs about how beautiful and serene it all is. Every vendor Yolanda has in her arsenal is remarkable and a joy to work with - she wouldn't have it any other way and that is how you know you're looking at the right venue/planner. The day-of coordinator (Terri) is a MUST-DO for Brides. We actually ate at our wedding! We had our first meal as husband and wife and no one even knew and just assumed the wedding norm ( that you don’t get to eat the delicious food you hand-selected!) It was absolutely incredible. Everyone was so surprised that she answered all of their questions, let them do whatever they wanted within reason and even partied and had a blast with us. You will not find a more flexible venue/planner anywhere. There were bridesmaid's guests that were not a part of the wedding party and while we were off taking pictures or getting ready, she let them hang out, swim in the pool and generally do whatever as if they were at their own homes. In terms of the wedding, she was willing to go above and beyond to make the day special for us. She found us the perfect officiant who let us do a cultural element as part of our ceremony – something they were equally as excited to see executed. We wanted to light off lanterns at the end of the night and she said absolutely. Nothing was out of the realm of possibilities or "against the rules" and that is how your wedding day should be - exactly as you want. Everywhere else we looked there was a “No-no” list of things you cannot do – be out by 11, no open flames, no loud music, etc etc. That list does not exist at Oak Island and they will try to accommodate all of your requests within reason.

If you are looking for a one of a kind wedding experience with seasoned professionals, listen to their advice (they've done way more weddings than you!) and go with Oak Island Weddings. We could not have been happier with our choice.

name: Allison Stewart
text: Stop looking at any other venues because the Barn and Twin Valley is the best! The Barn at Twin Valley made our wedding day SO special and one we will always treasure. The entire process from visiting the venue to the day off was overwhelmingly enjoyable. Lyn, Patty and Lucy were such a pleasure to work with. They are true examples of classy hospitality. As the bride, I did not stress one bit on the day of my wedding because I trusted in them completely. They are professionals and know exactly what to do -- down to the smallest details. The venue itself is BEAUTIFUL! You have several options of where you want your ceremony to take place and they tailor the rest of the venue to what makes you happy. They have a room full of every decoration you can think of too! This was one of the best things because it took away a lot of stress from me and my family. You have the option to pay an additional charge and they take care of EVERYTHING when it comes to decorating. I highly recommend you do this because it ends up saving you a lot of money and time. The venue also accommodates for your entire bridal party. We got ready at the venue and it was so much fun! There is a ton of space and all of our vendors were pleased with the venue for their own needs. Also, the venue can hold a ton of people too! Our wedding was probably over 250 people and it was no problem for them to handle. Again, having our wedding at the Barn and Twin Valley was one of the BEST decisions my husband and I made for our wedding. Since they took away a lot of stress, we were able to focus more on marriage counseling and all of the fun things that come along with wedding planning! I will continue recommending it to everyone because I am confident that you will be satisfied! Remember, a wedding is a day and a marriage is a lifetime -- so let the professionals at the Barn at Twin Valley take away all of your stresses you may have -- you will be guaranteed to have your dream day! Then you can look back and be joyful over how smoothly everything went and look forward to the rest of your life as husband and wife!

name: tay13_xo
text: I went to check out the place and loved a lot about it so I booked a date over a year in advance, then returned to the venue with my bridesmaids after it had rained and noticed a smell of manure. I understand there are farm animals surrounding the "what used to be a functional barn" but no one wants to smell poop on their wedding day. I quickly told them that I changed my mind and they verbally agreed to return my $500. If someone else book October 14th. Well we booked the venue over a year in advance so it was a waiting game. The form you fill out clearly said no refunds however given the advanced booking she verbalized there wouldn't be an issue with giving me a return once it's booked. Well after emailing maybe 4-5 times to see if it was booked, she seemed to get irritated and acted like the conversation never occurred. Well I have not received my refund and she refuses to talk to me about it. I don't have parents to pay for my wedding so I am paying for my own, and this was a hit to my budget. I am a nurse so it's going to take quite some time saving. If she didn't plan on giving me a refund then it would have been nice for her just to say this instead of ignoring me. Very disappointed.

name: Taylor Ormon
text: The Southerly was the absolute perfect venue for our wedding this past March! They could not have been more accommodating to our needs and wants during the entire planning process. I planned my wedding from afar and each time I came into town and needed to meet with one of the wedding coordinators they made time in their busy schedule to make sure they could meet with me. The customer service is absolutely outstanding, the day of the event we did not have to worry about one thing. During the reception they made sure that we were taken care of and that everything ran smoothly. My vendors could not have been more complimentary of the constant communication that The Southerly had with each of them giving them all the details they needed. I would recommend this venue to all! I had the best experience and would not change a thing. Thank you for making it a night that we will cherish forever!!

resp.text: We are so glad to hear this! The Southerly strives to make sure each bride feels taken care of throughout their planning experience. Thank you so much for your feedback, Taylor!

text:
Pros:  Beautiful wedding venue
Cons:  $$$$$; inattentive staff on day of wedding;  phone calls not returned; facilities, including main entrance doors, under renovation.

resp.text: Janet, thank you for the feedback! We apologize for your experience not meeting every expectation you had. We strive to make sure our guests are well taken care of throughout their unique event planning journey with us. Exceeding our guest expectations through planning and southern hospitality is our primary goal. With that said, we apologize that you felt otherwise. We'd love to have a conversation with you personally about how we can improve; please give us a call at your convenience. Your perspective is highly valued. Thank you again for your feedback.
